title: Release Train Engineer in Performance Emissions & OBD Integration
description:
Release Train Engineer in Performance Emissions & OBD Integration  



  

*TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation - Let´s make a difference together. Find out more:* *www.traton.com*  

*Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.*  



We are looking for a new colleague within the section Performance & Emissions Integration, who wants to join the Group R&D change journey.  

The role offers the flexibility to be based in any of the locations where the Group HR R&D organization operates (Nürnberg, Germany; Södertälje, Sweden; Lisle, USA), depending on the candidate’s preference and location.  


**Role Summary**  



We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Release Train Engineer (RTE) to support and drive our VCT Performance Emissions & OBD Integration. The RTE will be responsible for ensuring seamless coordination between cross-functional teams, maintaining alignment with program objectives, and enabling continuous delivery of value in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. This is a pivotal leadership role for an individual who is passionate about Agile methodologies, systems integration, and automotive technology.  


**Job Responsibilities**  


* Act as the chief servant leader and coach of the VCT, guiding teams towards the successful delivery of complex system integration ensuring emissions and OBD compliance
* Facilitate agile events (e.g., PI Planning, System Demos, daily stand-up) and ensure timely completion of program-level objectives and deliverables
* Drive continuous improvement by identifying process bottlenecks, fostering a culture of innovation, and implementing Agile best practices tailored to automotive product development
* Collaborate with Product Management and System Architects to clarify requirements, manage dependencies, and mitigate risks
* Aligning time plans and deliveries inside and outside of VCT
* Facilitate and coordinate of workflow of the VCT in Jira
* Monitor metrics, report on program health, and proactively address obstacles to ensure the highest quality deliverables
* Support the development of high-performing teams by mentoring Scrum Masters, Product Owners, and Agile team members
* Communicate regularly with leadership stakeholders, providing transparency into VCT progress and program maturity
* Ensure compliance with internal process and quality standards and external regulatory requirements for emissions and OBD systems

  

  

As our new Group is part of TRATON Group, we are closely collaborating we are working with all brands in the Group (Scania, MAN, INTERNATIONAL). In your role it’s therefore important to have a Group perspective while taking all brands into consideration.  


**Who You Are**  


* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical discipline
* 5+ years of experience in engine systems or software engineering, preferably in the automotive industry
* 2+ years of experience as a Release Train Engineer, Agile Program Manager, or similar role
* Understanding of Agile frameworks (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban) and practical experience applying them to complex technical programs
* Excellent facilitation, communication, and conflict resolution skills
* Proven track record of guiding cross-disciplinary programs to successful completion
* Experience with regulatory compliance and certification processes for emissions and diagnostics systems
* Knowledge of vehicle performance, emissions technologies and OBD integration is highly preferred
* Familiarity with tools such as Jira, Confluence, and DevOps pipelines
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, highly regulated, and collaborative environment
* SAFe Release Train Engineer (RTE) certification or equivalent is a strong plus

  

  

*We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.*  


**This Is Us**  



The VCT Performance Emissions & OBD Integration consists of ten cross site teams spanning the entire development cycle from early integration concept development, via optimization of engine types for Brands in the Traton Group, to product follow up and support to production. We integrate engine and exhaust treatment hardware with software and calibration to meet legal requirements for emissions, power and OBD with optimized properties. The main operations of the VCT is in Södertälje and Nürnberg. You will report to the section manager of Performance & Emissions Integration.  



The management team for the section and VCT is a group of highly experienced leaders in performance and emissions integration with a proven track record of delivering world class solutions. We encourage a collaborative, inclusive, and supportive work culture that values professional growth and continuous learning.  

Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Being bigger also means being stronger. Together with our brands, we have the collective power to transform transportation.  


**Application**  

Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.  

  

Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-11-14.

Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.  

**Cross-Brand Recruiting**  



By applying for this position, please be aware that we will share your CV in order to be able to conduct a group-wide recruiting process.  

**If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:**Hiring Manager: Fredrik Lindström, +46 73 961 58 59, fredrik.lindstrom@scania.com

Bernhard Grimm, +49 160 96 57 42 45, bernhard.grimm@man.eu  


**We look forward to your application!**  


**Requisition ID:** 20887
**Number of Openings:** 1.0
**Part-time / Full-time:** Full-time
**Permanent / Temporary:** Permanent
**Country/Region:** SE
**Location(s):**Södertälje, SE, 151 38
**Required Travel:** 0-25%
**Workplace:** Hybrid

title: Verisure Graduate Program 2026 –AI Explorer (Product Applications & Platforms)
description:
Are you graduating in 2026 and looking for an exciting opportunity to start your career at the intersection of software development and artificial intelligence?


Do you want to explore how AI can shape the future of technology and drive innovation in a global environment?

**Join Verisure’s Graduate Program in autumn 2026 as a Tech Graduate – AI Explorer in our Build Chain & Tools team in Malmö!**

**About the Graduate Program**


Our Graduate Program is designed for students graduating in 2026 who are eager to transition into the professional world. It offers hands-on experience, mentorship, and a structured career development path.

  

As a participant, you will be involved in real-world projects from the start, working closely with experienced colleagues in an agile and innovative setting. This program provides exposure to different aspects of software development while offering long-term career growth opportunities within Verisure.

**About the Role**


The Build Chain & Tools team is part of Verisure’s Product Applications and Platform organization, supporting our development teams with state-of-the-art tools, CI/CD pipelines, and efficient development processes.


We are now looking for a Tech Graduate – AI Explorer with a passion for technology and innovation.  

This role is dynamic and offers great freedom to explore how AI can be leveraged to improve operations in both software development and CI/CD. You will play a key role in identifying, testing, and demonstrating AI solutions that streamline processes and create value for our development teams.


You will report to the Build Chain & Developer Experience Manager and work in a collaborative, forward-thinking environment where curiosity and initiative are encouraged.

**Responsibilities**

* Research and evaluate new AI technologies and tools for development and DevOps environments.
* Develop prototypes and demos to showcase how AI can be integrated into workflows.
* Support development teams with AI-related initiatives and provide practical guidance.
* Identify opportunities to apply AI in Continuous Integration (CI) and automation.
* Document and present insights, proof-of-concepts, and recommendations.
* Collaborate with other teams to drive innovation and knowledge sharing.

**Who We Are Looking For?**


We are looking for graduates who are eager to learn, take on complex challenges, and grow their skills in a structured and innovative environment. You should:  

* Have an academic degree in computer science, software development, or a related field – graduating in 2026.
* Have programming skills (e.g., Python, Java, or similar).
* Understand DevOps principles and CI/CD processes.
* Have a strong interest in AI/ML technologies and a desire to explore new tools.
* Be proactive, curious, and capable of working both independently and collaboratively.
* Have strong problem-solving skills and the ability to turn ideas into action.

Nice-to-Have

* Experience building simple ML models or using AI APIs.
* Knowledge of container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Familiarity with GitHub and its AI-related features.
* Experience with cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, or GCP.

**About Verisure**


Verisure is a global leader in professionally monitored security solutions, protecting over 5.5 million customers across 17 countries. Our Innovation Centre in Malmö is at the forefront of smart-home security, developing cutting-edge products and services.


At Verisure, we foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning. We provide our employees with the tools, mentorship, and opportunities needed to develop their careers while making a real impact.

**Why Join Our Graduate Program?**

* Start your career in autumn 2026 with a structured development program.
* Work on meaningful projects with real-world applications.
* Be part of a dynamic, high-performance team.
* Develop your skills through hands-on experience and mentorship.
* Enjoy a supportive work environment with an emphasis on collaboration and knowledge-sharing.
* Work in a great location – our bright and open office is just a 5-minute walk from Malmö Central Station.

**Are you ready to kick-start your career in autumn 2026 with Verisure?**  

Apply now and become a part of our Graduate Program!
company_description: Verisure, a fast growing company full of career opportunities. Verisure Belgium is part of a global organisation active in 14 countries.

title: Machine Learning DevOps - Cloud and Compute Cluster
description:
### **About Pathway**


Pathway is shaking the foundations of artificial intelligence by introducing the world’s first post-transformer model that adapts and thinks just like humans.


Pathway’s breakthrough architecture (BDH) outperforms Transformer and provides the enterprise with full visibility into how the model works. Combining the foundational model with the fastest data processing engine on the market, Pathway enables enterprises to move beyond incremental optimization and toward truly contextualized, experience-driven intelligence. The company is trusted by organizations such as NATO, La Poste, and Formula 1 racing teams.


Pathway is led by co-founder & CEO Zuzanna Stamirowska, a complexity scientist who created a team consisting of AI pioneers, including CTO Jan Chorowski who was the first person to apply Attention to speech and worked with Nobel laureate Goeff Hinton at Google Brain, as well as CSO Adrian Kosowski, a leading computer scientist and quantum physicist who obtained his PhD at the age of 20.


The company is backed by leading investors and advisors, including TQ Ventures and Lukasz Kaiser, co-author of the Transformer (“the T” in ChatGPT) and a key researcher behind OpenAI’s reasoning models. Pathway is headquartered in Palo Alto, California.

### **The opportunity**


We are currently searching for a Machine Learning DevOps with experience in cloud and compute cluster management and Linux administration.


Our development and production environment is in the cloud, **using several major cloud providers**. We need support in **managing and automating the processes**, and **scaling** the infrastructure to growing team and production needs.

### **You Will**

* Optimize infrastructure for ML training and inference (e.g., GPUs, distributed compute).
* Automate and maintaining ML pipelines (data ingestion, training, validation, deployment).
* Manage model versioning, reproducibility, and traceability.
* Work with terabyte-large datasets.
* Implement ML-centric CI/CD practices.
* Monitor model performance and data drift in production.
* Collaborate with machine learning engineers, software engineers, and platform teams.


The role focuses on operationalizing machine learning models, ensuring scalability, reliability, and automation across the ML lifecycle.

**Requirements**

### **What We Are Looking For**

* Very good familiarity with Linux, shell scripts, and cluster configuration scripts as the basic work tool.
* Proficiency in workload management, containerization and orchestration (Slurm, Docker, Kubernetes).
* Solid grasp of CI/CD tools and workflows (GitHub Actions, Jenkins, Gitlab CI, etc.).
* Cloud infrastructure knowledge (AWS, GCP, Azure) – especially in ML services (e.g., SageMaker, Vertex AI).
* Familiarity with monitoring/logging tools (Grafana).
* Experience with infrastructure as code (Terraform, CloudFormation).
* Experience with ML pipeline orchestration tools (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow, Airflow, Metaflow).
* Programming skills in Python (with exposure to ML libraries like TensorFlow, PyTorch).
* Willingness to learn.

**Benefits**

### **Why You Should Apply**

* Intellectually stimulating work environment. Be a pioneer: you get to work with realtime data processing & AI.
* Work in one of the hottest AI startups, with exciting career prospects. Team members are distributed across the world.
* Responsibilities and ability to make significant contribution to the company’ success
* Inclusive workplace culture

### **Further details**

* **Type of contract**: Permanent employment contract
* **Preferable joining date**: Immediate.
* **Compensation**: based on profile and location.
* **Location**: Remote work. Possibility to work or meet with other team members in one of our offices: Palo Alto, CA; Paris, France or Wroclaw, Poland. Candidates based anywhere in the EU, United States, and Canada will be considered.

title: Simulation and Software Integration Engineer
description:
**Role Description**
--------------------


We are looking for a senior engineer to lead simulation and software integration across complex systems. You will design, integrate, and validate components and APIs, enable reliable build and deployment workflows on Linux, and drive quality through automation and robust engineering practices.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Design and implement object-oriented software in Python and/or C++.
* Integrate internal and third-party components, APIs, and external libraries.
* Set up and maintain Linux-based build and tooling workflows using Docker and CMake.
* Build and optimize CI/CD pipelines and DevOps automation with Jenkins and Kubernetes.
* Contribute to simulation environments, test design, verification strategies, and result analysis.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot integration issues and improve system performance.
* Document architecture, interfaces, and integration procedures for maintainability and reuse.

**Requirements**
----------------

* 10+ years of professional experience in system development and integration.
* Strong object-oriented programming skills in Python and/or C++.
* Proven experience integrating software components, APIs, and external libraries.
* Solid Linux proficiency, including Docker and CMake.
* Practical experience with DevOps practices, automation, Jenkins, and Kubernetes.
* Clear, structured communication and ability to collaborate across teams.

**Meritorious**
---------------

* Experience with ADAS simulation, testing, and verification.
* Familiarity with AUTOSAR (Adaptive and/or Classic).
* Knowledge of vehicle dynamics or prior work in the automotive domain.
* Experience in agile roles such as Scrum Master or Product Owner.

**Start/Duration**
------------------

* Start: ASAP
* Duration: Until 2026-11-13 (extension possible)

**Location**
------------

* Gothenburg, Sweden

### **About Rasulson Consulting**


Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm within the IT sector. We partner with established technology companies as well as innovative startups to offer attractive career opportunities for professionals looking to grow within digital development and IT. With our strong technical expertise and extensive network, we effectively match the right consultant with the right assignment. At Rasulson Consulting, you will receive personalized guidance, ongoing feedback, and the opportunity to take the next step in your career.

title: Solutions Engineer II (presales) - Cloud and Cybersecurity
description:
**Job Description**
**Are you passionate about Internet technologies and cloud computing?**
**Do you love helping customers overcome challenges?**
**Join our Solutions Engineering team**
 The PreSales engineering team is the technical partner to Sales. We provide unanticipated value and strive to provide the right solutions to our customers. Our team possesses the deepest levels of technical understanding and builds relationships to understand customer business drivers. We match these to Akamai's technology, and clearly articulating complex solutions to our customers.
   

  

**Shape the future of the Internet**
 We work with world leading companies in every major industry to make the internet fast and secure. As Solutions Engineer, you'll build relationships, becoming a trusted advisor to our customers, delivering innovative solutions. You will get to work with all the technologies Akamai has to offer. You will become an expert in Cloud and Cybersecurity.
   

  

**As a Solutions Engineer, You Will Be Responsible For**
* Growing revenue and acquire new business by evangelizing Akamai's technology to existing and prospective customers.
* Managing the technical proposal process and ensuring all technical information and recommendations addressing customer requirements are accurate.
* Engaging with customers during the sales-cycle to gather requirements and develop proposals, design, delivery, demo's and proof-of-concepts.
* Collaborating with internal Stakeholders to strengthen customer relationships by becoming the go-to person for technical queries.


**Do What You Love**
 To be successful in this role you will:
   

  

* Have experience in a technical pre-sales/sales engineering, consulting, or customer facing role delivering technical products or services.
* Demonstrate knowledge in Cloud and Internet technologies, including security solutions, compute, content delivery and web architecture (DNS,HTTP,TCP/IP,TLS).
* Have interpersonal savvy, a passion to solve problems, and a customer focused mindset.
* Have a thirst for learning and embracing new technologies.
* Be a good team player, able to collaborate, prioritize, and solve problems in a fast changing environment.
* Be fluent in both Swedish and English


**Work in a way that works for you**
 FlexBase, Akamai's Global Flexible Working Program, is based on the principles that are helping us create the best workplace in the world. When our colleagues said that flexible working was important to them, we listened. We also know flexible working is important to many of the incredible people considering joining Akamai. FlexBase, gives 95% of employees the choice to work from their home, their office, or both (in the country advertised). This permanent workplace flexibility program is consistent and fair globally, to help us find incredible talent, virtually anywhere. We are happy to discuss working options for this role and encourage you to speak with your recruiter in more detail when you apply.
   

  

 Learn what makes Akamai a great place to work
   

  

 Connect with us on social and see what life at Akamai is like!
   

  

**We power and protect life online, by solving the toughest challenges, together.**
 At Akamai, we're curious, innovative, collaborative and tenacious. We celebrate diversity of thought and we hold an unwavering belief that we can make a meaningful difference. Our teams use their global perspectives to put customers at the forefront of everything they do, so if you are people-centric, you'll thrive here.
   

  

**Working for you**
**Benefits**
 At Akamai, we will provide you with opportunities to grow, flourish, and achieve great things. Our benefit options are designed to meet your individual needs for today and in the future. We provide benefits surrounding all aspects of your life:
   

  

* Your health
* Your finances
* Your family
* Your time at work
* Your time pursuing other endeavors


 Our benefit plan options are designed to meet your individual needs and budget, both today and in the future.
   

  

**About Us**
 Akamai powers and protects life online. Leading companies worldwide choose Akamai to build, deliver, and secure their digital experiences helping billions of people live, work, and play every day. With the world's most distributed compute platform from cloud to edge we make it easy for customers to develop and run applications, while we keep experiences closer to users and threats farther away.
   

  

**Join us**
 Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!

title: Senior Azure Engineer
description:
Vi letar efter dig som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär inom Azure och trivs med att arbeta nära kund i lösningar som gör skillnad. På Innofactor jobbar vi med både privat och offentlig sektor, i uppdrag där du får använda hela din tekniska bredd – och samtidigt utvecklas vidare inom säkerhet, AI och automation.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som
 **Senior Azure Engineer** 
 kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i vårt team inom Cloud och Infrastruktur. Du arbetar i både nya och pågående uppdrag – ofta i teknikintensiva miljöer där vi bygger smarta, skalbara och säkra lösningar i Azure.
   

  

 ✅ Bygga, drifta och automatisera lösningar i Azure (App Services, VMs, Kubernetes, Logic Apps, Azure Functions)
   

  

 ✅ Säkra och optimera kunders molnmiljöer – inklusive nätverk, datalagring och databaser (Azure SQL, PostgreSQL, CosmosDB)
   

  

 ✅ Arbeta med Infrastructure as Code – främst Bicep och pipelines i Azure DevOps, ibland även PowerShell
   

  

 ✅ Implementera AI- och säkerhetslösningar för att förbättra våra kunders miljöer
   

  

 ✅ Ta teknisk lead i projekt – från design till implementation
   

  

 Du kan självklart jobba både hemifrån och från kontoret. Bor du i Stockholm ser vi gärna att du tittar in ibland.
   

  

**Det vi letar efter**
 ✅ Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att implementera eller förvalta lösningar i Azure
   

  

 ✅ God kunskap om Azure-nätverk – t.ex. VPN Gateway, VNET, ExpressRoute, WAF
   

  

 ✅ Vana vid Azure DevOps, PowerShell, Git och IaC (t.ex. Bicep eller Terraform)
   

  

 Vi tror att du är nyfiken, självgående och gillar att arbeta nära kund. Hos oss jobbar vi agilt, i team med mycket kompetens och stort eget ansvar – och vi hjälper varandra att lyckas.
   

  

 Saker som kan vara till hjälp, men som du inte behöver kunna från början:
   

  

 ➕ Erfarenhet av AI-tjänster i Azure
   

  

 ➕ Certifieringar som AZ-104, AZ-305 eller liknande
   

  

 ➕ Vana vid agila arbetssätt (Scrum, Kanban)
   

  

 Vad du får hos oss
   

  

 Du blir en viktig del av vårt Cloud-team – ett tight, kunnigt gäng med stort engagemang och stark Microsoft-koppling. Här får du arbeta med moderna tekniker, utveckla din kompetens och vara med och påverka både din roll och våra leveranser.
   

  

 Förmåner
   

  

* Kompetensutveckling
* Flexibelt arbete
* Kollegor som stöttar och delar med sig
* Akiviteter och nätverk


 Och du – sök redan idag, vi anställer löpande!
   

  

**Innofactor** 
 är den ledande drivkraften bakom den moderna digitala organisationen i Norden. Vi jobbar med över 1 000 kunder inom både privat och offentlig sektor, har det bredaste lösningsutbudet och den starkaste Microsoft-kompetensen i regionen. Vi är cirka 550 specialister i Finland, Sverige, Danmark och Norge.
   

  

 👉 www.innofactor.com
   

  

 #PeopleFirst #AIDriven #BeTheRealYou

title: AI Systems Engineer
description:
**Introducing evroc**
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European owned hyperscale cloud.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
   

  

**Join the Pioneers**
 This is a rare opportunity to influence the technical foundation of a European hyperscaler— at the very beginning.
   

  

 As an AI Systems Engineer at evroc, you will be at the center of developing and operating our AI platform services, providing evroc’s customers/users with a superior experience, ranging from inference-as-a-service to infrastructure for large-scale training.
   

  

 Working with the latest Nvidia GPU hardware and open-source AI technologies, you’ll ensure our platform is secure, resource efficient, and performant. evroc's AI services bring European sovereignty, data privacy, and sustainability to AI application developers.
   

  

 You will work in close collaboration with infrastructure, platform, and storage teams, across our development hubs in Stockholm, Sophia Antipolis (France), and London.
   

  

**What You’ll Tackle**
* Designing, building, and maintaining a production platform for AI inference and training, based on Kubernetes.
* Implementing multi-tenancy in GPU-accelerated platforms, ensuring efficient resource sharing, workload isolation, and scheduling.
* Optimizing resource utilization and performance of AI inference and training workloads.
* Monitoring and metrics collection for real-time control and accounting.
* Security in all aspects, from user authentication to GPU attestation.


**Skills We Value**
* Operating system fundamentals, e.g., containerization, virtualization, and device drivers, including SR-IOV and RDMA.
* Operational experience with Kubernetes.
* GPU low-level software stack, e.g., Nvidia CUDA, MIG, GPU Operator, DCGM, and GPU interconnect software.
* AI/ML frameworks and runtimes, e.g., vLLM and PyTorch.
* Distributed systems fundamentals, including networking, scheduling, and resource allocation.
* Software development in programming languages such as Golang, Rust, and Python.
* Security technologies, e.g. TPM, TEE, and Confidential Computing.
* Strong problem-solving and communication skills to effectively address complex platform engineering challenges.


 We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!
   

  

 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.
   

  

 Applicants must possess a valid work permit.

title: IAM Security Specialist
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Our Identity and Access Management Service Area is looking for an IAM Security Specialist to join us. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work in a large and experienced team of Identity and Access Management professionals who provide comprehensive solutions in the IAM area.As an IAM Security Specialist, you will act as a technical specialist in our Identity and Access Management continuous services. You will support, implement, integrate, and deploy IAM solutions. The role also includes documentation and testing. You will have the chance to work with advanced technologies and collaborate with a highly skilled team.Previous experience and interest in cybersecurity and IAM are considered assets. This position is ideal for someone with an analytical mindset, basic programming knowledge, and strong communication and documentation skills. The position will be located in Espoo, Finland or Stockholm, Sweden. We support remote work. English is our working language. The position is permanent and full-time. There might be a need for on-call work.
   

  

**Power up DNV – refer from your network!**
 #DNVCyber
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* A challenging and versatile role with a meaningful mission
* A strong company culture that emphasizes continuous learning and professional growth
* Supportive and collaborative colleagues who value teamwork
* An international working environment with diverse perspectives
* Exciting projects in critical sectors, both locally and globally
* Great benefits, such as extensive health care, dental care, sports, culture and wellbeing and a bike benefit
* Flexible working hours with a strong focus on work–life balance
* Regular social events, sports activities, and team-building opportunities


 DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity.
   

  

**About You**
 In this role we hope to see:
   

  

* Understanding of IAM concepts and systems, with familiarity with key standards
* Previous experience or a strong interest in working with various identity, access, and privileged account management solutions
* Familiarity with DevOps Tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub)
* SQL skills
* Programming skills, preferably Java
* General understanding of web API´s (REST, JSON)
* Expertise in complex technical environments, process automation, and agile development methodologies
* Ability to lead the design and development of PAM solutions, ensuring alignment with security policies and access management requirements
* Basic knowledge of Active Directory, Azure AD
* This role requires strong communication and documentation skills in English


**Nice To Have**
* Prior experience in building IGA or PAM Architecture
* Experience in modern IAM technologies like Saviynt, Delinea, BeyondTrust or Sailpoint
* Professional security certifications such as CISSP, CISA, CISM etc.


*Security and compliance with statutory requirements in the countries in which we operate is essential for DNV. Background checks will be conducted on all final candidates as part of the offer process, in accordance with applicable country-specific laws and practices.*

title: Lead Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO:**
* Lead and deliver complex AI/ML initiatives involving multiple stakeholders, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality, business-critical solutions.
* Architect scalable, enterprise-level solutions by setting the technical direction and ensuring robust, future - proof designs.
* Drive technical excellence and innovation by collaborating across departments, improving engineering practices and integrating emerging technologies and industry trends.
* Identify risks and dependencies as well as creating the alignment needed with dependent teams in order to deliver on committed roadmaps.
* Mentor and develop engineering talent, fostering professional growth, and promoting a strong, collaborative engineering culture.
* Represent and strengthen the Machine Learning Engineering area through active participation in organizational initiatives such as recruitment, onboarding, and strategic collaborations.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 You’ll work closely with machine learning engineers, data scientists, data analysts, solution architects, business stakeholders, and engineering managers to build and enhance AI-powered products that drive innovation and efficiency across the supply chain.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for people with…
   

  

* Proven experience across multiple programming languages, tools and frameworks relevant to AI/ML development.
* Strong expertise in MLOps, including testing, monitoring and proactive incident management to ensure product stability.
* Deep understanding of system architecture, design, performance optimization and security principles for building robust AI/ML solutions.
* Knowledge across data engineering, software engineering and data science to enable effective cross-functional collaboration.
* Ability to break down complex initiatives into actionable steps, clearly communication plans and align teams around execution.


 Also preferred if you have:
   

  

* Hands-on experience with mathematical optimization techniques (e.g. linear and mixed-integer optimization) and a strong understanding of supply chain processes such as allocation, demand forecasting, and supply planning.


 And people who have
   

  

* Strong leadership and mentorship skills, with the ability to foster a positive and collaborative environment.
* Ability to drive innovation and continuously improve engineering practices and ways of working.
* Excellent communication skills to engage stakeholders, influence decisions and align work with strategic goals.
* The ability to navigate ambiguity and take a structured, step by step approach to achieve meaningful outcomes.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Utvecklare Optimizely
description:
**Att jobba som Utvecklare Optimizely**
 Som Optimizelyutvecklare i Vårt Team Everweb Blir Du En Nyckelspelare i Vår Stora Satsning På Digital Transformation. Dina Arbetsuppgifter Består Av Att
   

  

* Utveckla och driva Skandias webbplatser inom Optimizely CMS
* Stötta och supporta interna redaktörer
* Möjliggöra smidig innehållshantering för både externa och interna webbar samt appar
* Ansvara för teknisk design och delta i kravdiskussioner


 Du kommer till ett starkt och erfaret team av utvecklare och testare som arbetar tillsammans med design, utveckling, testautomatisering och automatiserade deploy:er. En arbetsmiljö där mobb- och parprogrammering samt gemensam kravrefinering är en självklarhet och en kultur som präglas av glädje, humor och stark gemenskap.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Gedigen erfarenhet av .NET, Optimizely CMS (fd Episerver) och frontendutveckling
* Passion för programmering, problemlösning och struktur
* Ett öga för helheten och konsumenternas behov
* Intresse för automatisering av tester och deploy:er


**Meriterande Erfarenheter**
 Optimizely CMS 12, Headless CMS, TypeScript, React, Octopus Deploy och Azure DevOps.
   

  

 Vi tror att du är en självgående lagspelare som tar initiativ, gillar att dela med dig av din kunskap och låter glädje och humor bli en naturlig del av vardagen.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Stephan Mannerfelt på mailadress stephan.mannerfelt@skandia.se
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Observability Specialist
description:
**Job Description**
 De säger att "det är inte raketvetenskap." Vi håller inte med.
   

  

 Välkommen till SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, den perfekta arbetsplatsen för dig som brinner för teknik i allmänhet och rymden i synnerhet.
   

  

 Med rymdorganisationer, forskningsinstitut, institutionella och kommersiella aktörer som kunder, erbjuder vi specialistkompetens inom satellitkommunikation, rymdkonsulttjänster, raket- och ballongsystem, flygtesttjänster, framdrivningssystem för satelliter och mycket mer.
   

  

 SSC har dessutom ett av världens största globala nätverk av markstationer för satellitkommunikation. Vi äger och driver rymdbasen Esrange i Kiruna i norra Sverige, med sikte att i närtid kunna skjuta upp satelliter.
   

  

 Är du driven av en passion för människor och med ambitionen att skapa en fantastisk arbetsplats? Är du redo att ge dig ut på en spännande resa med oss för att hjälpa jorden att dra nytta av rymden?
   

  

 Om du svarar ja på dessa frågor, uppmanar vi dig att ta chansen att göra verklig skillnad som vår Observability Specialist.
   

  

 Vi söker en driven person som delar våra kärnvärden: Kundfokus, Omtanke, Samarbete, Nyfikenhet och Mod.
   

  

 På SSC är observability inte bara en lyx – det är avgörande. Våra system stödjer tidskritiska uppdrag och vetenskapliga operationer, och vi behöver full insyn för att säkerställa att de fungerar pålitligt och säkert.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en Observability Specialist som kan hjälpa oss att se allt från loggar, mätvärden och spårningar till alla dolda signaler som håller våra plattformar friska, både lokalt och i AWS. Det här är en unik möjlighet att ta ett helhetsgrepp om SSC:s övervakning genom att forma strategin, välja verktygen och bygga upp en modern observability-plattform som blir en gemensam tjänst för hela organisationen. Här får du stort inflytande över både teknik och arbetssätt, och en central roll i att bygga en funktion som används av både IT och våra tekniska divisioner. Du äger området observability och driver det framåt tillsammans med kollegor som delar ditt engagemang för tillförlitliga system, utveckling och långsiktiga lösningar.
   

  

**Job Requirements**
 DIN ROLL
   

  

 Som Observability Specialist utvecklar och implementerar du de verktyg och ramverk som gör våra system observerbara. Från loggar och mätvärden till spårning och dashboards ser du till att våra plattformar är väl instrumenterade, övervakade och optimerade för prestanda och tillförlitlighet.
   

  

**Vad Du Kommer Att Göra**
* Designa och drifta övervakningslösningar (t.ex. Grafana, Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, CloudWatch)
* Definiera standarder för loggning, mätvärden och spårning
* Skapa dashboards och larm som verkligen gör skillnad
* Stötta team i att instrumentera tjänster för observability
* Undersöka incidenter med hjälp avobservability-data och verktyg
* Vägleda bästa praxis för loggstruktur, lagring och kostnadshantering
* Stötta efterlevnad och revision kopplat till övervakning
* Samarbeta med DevOps och SecOps för att integrera observability i leveranspipelines
* APM –Application Performance Monitoring
* Implementera Incident Management-processer inom O11Y-stacken, t.ex. Prometheus, JIRA, PagerDuty.


**Job Responsibilities**
 VEM DU ÄR
   

  

 Du är nyfiken och vill förstå hur system fungerar i detalj och trivs med att analysera vad som händer när något går fel. Du arbetar praktiskt och söker alltid förbättringar bortom "good enough". Du bygger observability inte bara för att övervaka, utan för att förstå och agera. Du bidrar med struktur, samarbete och tydlig kommunikation i det dagliga arbetet, och är bekväm med att navigera både på svenska och engelska i en professionell miljö.
   

  

**Vad Vi Söker**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av övervakning och loggning i moln-eller hybridmiljöer
* God vana vid att konfigurera AWS-tjänster inom detta område
* Erfarenhet av verktyg som Grafana, Loki, Prometheus, Cloud Watch eller ELK
* Förståelse för principer kring mätvärden, loggar och distribuerad spårning
* Bekantskap med SLO:er, larmstrategier och incidenthanteringsprocesser.


**Vi Värdesätter Erfarenhet Inom**
* OpenTelemetry eller andra observability-ramverk
* Bakgrund inom SRE,DevOpseller plattformsutveckling
* AWS-certifiering(ar).


**Job Benefits**
 VI ERBJUDER DIG
   

  

* En av världens mest spännande och snabbast växande branscher inom rymdbranschen.
* En spännande och dynamisk arbetsplats med medarbetare och kunder över hela världen.
* Utrymme att utvecklas i takt med företagets tillväxt och framtidsmål.
* 30 dagars semester samt traditionella helgdagar – vi erbjuder dessutom extra lediga dagar.
* Utöver semester och traditionella helgdagar erbjuder vi extra betald ledighet under året, såsom ledigt mellan jul och nyår,Kristi himmelsfärdsdag– totalt 6–11 extra dagar beroende på kalendern.
* Friskvårdsbidrag (5 000 SEK/år).
* Attraktiv tjänstepension (ITP) och möjlighet att löneväxla till pension.
* En internationell arbetsplats som präglas av en öppen atmosfär och ett utmanande arbetsklimat i ständig utveckling.


 PLACERING
   

  

 Detta är en tillsvidareanställning på 40 timmar/vecka, med placering på vårt kontor i Solna Strand.
   

  

  

  

 MER INFORMATION
   

  

 Vid frågor som rör anställningsvillkor eller fackliga frågor är du välkommen att kontakta våra fackliga representanter:
   

  

 Sveriges Ingenjörer: af@sscspace.com
   

  

 Unionen: unionen@sscspace.com
   

  

  

  

 NÄSTA STEG
   

  

 Om denna möjlighet väcker ditt intresse så är du varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande och intervjuer genomförs under processens gång. Vänligen bifoga ditt CV i samband med ansökan. Du har möjlighet att komplettera med ett personligt brev, men vår bedömning kommer i första hand att utgå från din kompetens och erfarenhet som framgår av CV:t, i syfte att säkerställa en rättvis och objektiv rekryteringsprocess.
   

  

 Observera att annonsen kan komma att stängas i förtid om vi får in ett stort antal ansökningar, för att kunna säkerställa en effektiv process och ge varje kandidat rättvis uppmärksamhet.
   

  

  

  

 Detta är en säkerhetsklassad position och kommer att kräva en bakgrundskontroll före anställning.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan till och med 2025-12-08.
   

  

  

  

 VI HJÄLPER JORDEN ATT DRA NYTTA AV RYMDEN
   

  

 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) är en ledande global leverantör av avancerade rymdtjänster med mer än 50 års erfarenhet. Vi hjälper rymdorganisationer, forskningsinstitut, kommersiella och institutionella aktörer från hela världen att få tillgång till rymden.
   

  

 Med lokal närvaro på alla kontinenter och cirka 700 engagerade medarbetare erbjuder vi specialistkompetens inom satellitkommunikation och satellitkontrolltjänster, rymdfarkostoperationer, raket- och ballongsystem, uppskjutningstjänster och flygtesttjänster, samt ingenjörs-, drift- och konsulttjänster för rymduppdrag.
   

  

 We help Earth benefit from space. Läs mer på sscspace.com

title: Senior Fullstackutvecklare inom Java
description:
**Senior Fullstackutvecklare inom Java till Accelerate at Iver!**
 Vill du ta din expertis inom fullstackutveckling till nästa nivå? Vi söker en skicklig utvecklare med lång erfarenhet av Java och moderna frontend-ramverk som vill vara med och bygga framtidens digitala lösningar tillsammans med oss på Accelerate at Iver.
   

  

**Varför Accelerate at Iver?**
 Vi erbjuder mer än bara ett uppdrag – vi erbjuder en plattform för att växa som expert inom modern mjukvaruutveckling! Hos oss får du inte bara arbeta med spännande teknik och kunder – du blir en del av ett värderingsdrivet, passionerat team där du får stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling och inflytande.
   

  

**Som Konsult Hos Oss Får Du**
 🎯 En skräddarsydd utvecklings- och certifieringsplan
   

  

 🚀 Utmanande och varierande kunduppdrag med den senaste tekniken
   

  

 🕊️ Flexibilitet, frihet och balans mellan jobb och fritid
   

  

 🛡️ En trygg och säker anställning med bra förmåner och kollektivavtal
   

  

 🤜🤛 Ett sammansvetsat team av vassa specialister som lyfter varandra
   

  

 Vi tror på gemenskap och kompetensutbyte – här utvecklas vi tillsammans och stöttar varandra för att alltid ligga i teknisk framkant.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som senior fullstackutvecklare inom Java hos oss är du en nyckelspelare i att utveckla stabila, moderna och skalbara applikationer. Du bidrar med både teknisk erfarenhet och ett agilt mindset i projekt som gör skillnad.
   

  

 Du arbetar både med backendlogik i Java och Spring Boot, och med moderna frontendramverk som React och Angular. Du jobbar nära DevOps och är bekväm med CI/CD, containerisering och molnmiljöer.
   

  

**Exempel på vad du kommer att göra i ditt konsultuppdrag:**
* Utveckla och underhålla mikrotjänstbaserade backendlösningar i Java/Spring Boot
* Skapa intuitiva och responsiva användargränssnitt med React, Angular eller liknande.
* Arbeta med databaser som MySQL och Oracle DB
* Bygga och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines för automatisk testning och leverans
* Arbeta med Docker och Kubernetes för containerhantering och orkestrering
* Delta i arkitektur- och designbeslut samt mentorera juniora kollegor


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har minst 8 års erfarenhet som fullstackutvecklare, med djup kompetens inom Java och erfarenhet av moderna webbteknologier. Du är lösningsorienterad, gillar att jobba nära verksamheten och har ett öga för både teknik och användarvärde. Du har en akademisk utbildning med inriktning mot systemutveckling, webbutveckling eller liknande.
   

  

 Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift. För denna position krävs svenskt medborgarskap, vi utför även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat
   

  

**Vi tror att du har erfarenhet av några av följande:**
* Java, Spring Boot
* TypeScript/JavaScript
* React, Angular eller liknande
* MySQL, Oracle DB
* CI/CD-verktyg
* Docker och Kubernetes


**Extra Plus Om Du Har**
* Erfarenhet av molnlösningar (t.ex. Azure, AWS eller GCP)
* Erfarenhet av testautomatisering och TDD
* Certifieringar inom Java eller molnplattformar
* Erfarenhet av systemarkitektur eller teknisk ledarroll


**Placeringsort**
 📍 Accelerate at Iver finns på flertal orter i Sverige och Norge. För denna tjänst utgår du från vårt kontor i Solna, med möjlighet till hybridarbete.
   

  

**Vi intervjuar löpande – vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan!**
 👉 Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Har du frågor? Kontakta Jesper Carlsson på jesper.carlsson@iver.se
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot att träffa dig. Välkommen till Accelerate at Iver!** 
 🚀

title: Senior C++ Developer
description:
At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If you’re passionate about developing your career, while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.
   

  

 We are seeking
 **Senior C++ Software Engineers** 
 to help us drive our strategic vision transforming the trading landscape for our clients globally.
   

  

 Our associates embrace change, easily integrate, and succeed in a fast-paced global environment.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Participate in the design, development and testing of financial markets software products
* Developing and integrating different ways of information visualization
* Evolve technically while working on data-intensive latency-sensitive products
* Provide and receive constant technical feedback via well-established code-review practices
* Ensure internal quality standards are met through automated testing (e.g. unit, integration, performance, and throughput tests, etc.)
* Learn and improve your expertise in financial assets, investment banking, and financial technology
* Contribute and promote best practices in our development cycles using continuous integration.


**Profile Needed**
**Mandatory:**
* A bachelor’s degree from a recognized college or university in STEM, such as math, physics, computer science, engineering, etc.
* Over 8 years of C++ development experience in С++
* Solid knowledge of C++ features and programming techniques
* Comprehensive knowledge of basic algorithms and data structures
* Good understanding of modern C++ standards (C++ 17/20)
* Experience in debugging and troubleshooting
* Ability to work both independently and as part of a global team
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with an attention to detail
* Familiar with applying OOP concepts in environments with challenging performance demands
* Good communication skills with an effective level of English proficiency


**Beneficial:**
* Knowledge of financial markets and financial technologies
* Linux/Unix experience on advanced user or admin level
* Experience in multi-threaded programming
* Experience in low-latency software design, performance profiling and optimization
* Knowledge of Internet protocol suite and network programming
* Knowledge of the LLVM toolchain
* Understanding of functional programming concepts
* Experience in other programming languages (Java, Python, Shell scripting, Rust, Haskell, etc.)


**About Us**
 Broadridge Trading & Connectivity Solutions (BTCS) products and services power high-performance multi-asset trading automating the entire front office for investment banks and brokers. BTCS services cover all aspects of agency and principal risk trading, client connectivity services, Middle-Office and post-trade matching. Assets supported include Equities, FX, Derivatives. crypto and ETFs across all global markets.
   

  

 We are dedicated to fostering a collaborative, engaging, and inclusive environment and are committed to providing a workplace that empowers associates to be authentic and bring their best to work. We believe that associates do their best when they feel safe, understood, and valued, and we work diligently and collaboratively to ensure Broadridge is a company—and ultimately a community—that recognizes and celebrates everyone’s unique perspective.
   

  

**Use of AI in Hiring**
 As part of the recruiting process, Broadridge may use technology, including artificial intelligence (AI)-based tools, to help review and evaluate applications. These tools are used only to support our recruiters and hiring managers, and all employment decisions include human review to ensure fairness, accuracy, and compliance with applicable laws. Please note that honesty and transparency are critical to our hiring process. Any attempt to falsify, misrepresent, or disguise information in an application, resume, assessment, or interview will result in disqualification from consideration.

title: Senior SAP BTP Developer
description:
**Job Summary:** 




 We are looking for an experienced
 **Senior SAP BTP Developer** 
 with strong expertise in
 **SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)** 
 ,
 **CAP (Cloud Application Programming Model)** 
 ,
 **SAP UI5/Fiori** 
 , and
 **Integration Suite** 
 . The ideal candidate will design, develop, and implement enterprise-grade SAP cloud solutions with deep knowledge of integration, security, and DevOps pipelines.
 



  




**Key Responsibilities:** 
1. Design and develop
 **full-stack CAP applications** 
 (Node.js, HANA, UI5/Fiori).
2. Implement end-to-end solutions using
 **BTP services** 
 (XSUAA, Workflow, Event Mesh, Connectivity).
3. Lead
 **integration scenarios** 
 with
 **SAP Integration Suite (CPI, API Management, Event Mesh)** 
 .
4. Develop and extend
 **Fiori/UI5** 
 and
 **Fiori Elements** 
 applications.
5. Configure
 **Fiori Launchpad** 
 , roles, and authorizations in BTP and on-premise.
6. Manage
 **BTP accounts, subaccounts, trust, and SSO configurations** 
 (Azure AD, IAS).
7. Implement
 **CI/CD pipelines** 
 with Azure DevOps or Bitbucket.
8. Develop
 **custom CDS views** 
 , APIs, and event integrations for
 **S/4HANA Public Cloud** 
 .
9. Collaborate with functional and technical teams, drive best practices, and mentor developers.



  





**Required Skills & Qualifications:** 



1. 8+ years SAP experience (3+ years in BTP & CAPM).
2. Expertise in Node.js/Java, CDS, OData, SAP HANA Cloud, SAP BAS.
3. Strong in API development, JSON, REST, and cloud-native architecture.
4. Knowledge of XSUAA, multi-tenant apps, microservices.
5. Agile/Scrum, Git, CI/CD experience.
6. Preferred: BTP Certification, Fiori/UI5, Integration Suite, Event Mesh, Business Rules.

title: AI Implementation Manager
description:
**Shape the Future of SafetyTech with AI**


At **Consilium Safety Group**, we don’t just build technology — we create solutions that protect people, assets, and the planet. As a global leader in fire and gas safety, we serve critical industries such as marine, energy, rail, and construction.


With more than 100 years of expertise and 55 offices worldwide, we’re combining deep industry knowledge with cutting-edge innovation to redefine the future of SafetyTech. Backed by strong investors, we are now entering an exciting transformation and growth journey — and we’re looking for a hands-on **AI Implementation Manager** to lead the charge.

**Your Mission**


You will drive Consilium’s AI transformation — from strategy to execution.  

This is not a pure tech or data science role, but rather a project-driven, business-oriented position where you’ll bridge strategy, technology, and operations.


Your focus will be on identifying, prioritizing, and implementing AI-driven improvements across the company — ensuring measurable business value and adoption.

**What You’ll Do**

* Lead our AI transformation journey — from roadmap creation to execution and scaling.
* Translate business needs into actionable AI initiatives, ensuring clear value and ROI.
* Work closely with the Corporate Management Team (CMT) to communicate progress, present results, and secure alignment.
* Coordinate cross-functional teams — including IT, QA, PM, and departmental leads — to drive implementation.
* Collaborate with AI consultants and vendors to bring solutions to life.
* Improve processes and data quality to enable sustainable AI adoption.
* Be the internal AI champion — guiding acceptance, building enthusiasm, and helping teams use AI in their daily work.

**Who You Are**


You’re a doer and a bridge-builder — equally comfortable discussing business value with executives and technical requirements with IT.  

You thrive in change, can make things happen, and inspire others to join the journey.

**We think you’ll have:**

* 2–5 years of experience in project management, digital transformation, or AI/business process implementation.
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills — you can motivate, align, and follow up.
* A strategic and analytical mindset — comfortable building business cases and prioritizing initiatives.
* Experience working cross-functionally with IT, data, and business teams.
* A curious, pragmatic, and collaborative personality.

**Bonus points for experience with:**

* AI tools and technologies (e.g. LLMs, RAG, MLOps, Python, data pipelines).
* Azure, APIs, or cloud integrations.
* QA or process improvement projects.
* Working with or managing external AI consultants.

**Why Join Us?**

* **High visibility:** Work directly with the Corporate Management Team and influence company-wide transformation.
* **Impact:** Drive tangible change in how a global industry leader operates.
* **Purpose:** Contribute to technologies that protect lives and assets.
* **Culture:** Join a small, hands-on, curious, and supportive team that values progress over perfection.

**Apply Now**


If you’re ready to learn, contribute, and grow — apply today and help us shape the future of SafetyTech.

**Want to Learn More?**


Hear from our CEO, **Philip Isell Lind af Hageby**, on our transformation journey:  

**Philip Isell Lind af Hageby, Consilium, en mästare på turnarounds - Värdeskaparna | En podd om riskkapital av OPX Partners | Podcast on Spotify**

title: Senior CloudOps Engineer
description:
***Om Norteam***

*Norteam är inte bara ett IT-bolag – vi är ett team av engagerade människor som brinner för att göra skillnad. Med Microsofts ekosystem som grund hjälper vi företag att bli smartare, säkrare och mer hållbara. Vi har en kultur där du får vara dig själv, växa och ha kul på jobbet. Vår vision är enkel: IT can be more – och vi lever den varje dag.*

*Norteam är ett av Sveriges snabbast växande IT-bolag, ett faktum som för med sig naturliga utmaningar men också fantastiska möjligheter. Alla kollegor är nyckelpersoner i sina olika roller. Alla har möjlighet att- och förväntas bidra till teknik & tjänstepaketering, affärsutveckling och sälj – och inte minst, till kultur & vårt långsiktiga bolagsbyggande.*

*Vill du ta en central roll på resan tillsammans med oss alla på Norteam? Läs vidare!*

**Vad gör du som Senior CloudOps Engineer på Norteam?**


Som Senior CloudOps Engineer hos Norteam har du en avgörande roll i att säkerställa stabilitet, säkerhet och effektivitet i våra IT-tjänster. Du arbetar med avancerad felsökning, optimering och förbättring av våra kunders moln- och nätverksinfrastrukturer, särskilt inom Microsoft 365 och Azure. Du driver utvecklingen av moderna och hållbara IT-lösningar och är en viktig kunskapsresurs och mentor för CloudOperations-teamet och övriga inom förvaltnings- och utvecklingsorganisationen på Norteam.


Du har ett proaktivt ansvar för att identifiera och implementera förbättringar i IT-infrastrukturen, med särskilt fokus på automation och säkerhet. Du samarbetar nära CTO för att säkerställa att våra tjänster är skalbara, effektiva och kostnadseffektiva. Du bidrar även till att organisationens IT-miljö uppfyller säkerhetsstandarder och regelverk, och deltar i säkerhetsgranskningar och hotanalyser.


Du förväntas också bidra i det kontinuerliga arbetet kring hur vi paketerar våra produkter och tjänster gentemot våra kunder. Du har örat mot rälsen och förväntas bidra med omvärldsanalys och kunskap om ny teknologi.

**Hos oss får du möjlighet att:**

* Designa, implementera och optimera Azure- och Microsoft 365-tjänster
* Hantera lösningar inom PaaS (Platform as a Service) och IaaS (Infrastructure as a Service), inklusive Azure VM, Azure Virtual Desktop, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), Azure Container Apps m.m.
* Driva förbättringsprojekt inom moln, nätverk och IT-säkerhet
* Utveckla och implementera automatiseringslösningar för drift och hantering
* Fungera som teknisk expert och stöd för IT-support och infrastrukturteam
* Ansvara för felsökning och hantering av komplexa tekniska incidenter
* Stödja säkerhetsarbete genom säkerhetsoptimering och efterlevnad av policyer, bl a genom att implementera och hantera Azure Policy, RBAC och Workload Identity Federation
* Samarbeta med leverantörer och partners vid tekniska installationer och projekt
* Testa och utvärdera nya tekniska lösningar för att säkerställa innovation och utveckling

**Vem är du?**


Du är en Senior CloudOps Engineer med flerårig erfarenhet av att driva, utveckla och underhålla komplexa Cloudmiljöer, med fokus på Azure. Du är sannolikt personen som andra vänder sig till för avancerad felsökning, optimering och förbättring av moln- och nätverksinfrastrukturer.


Du är självgående och initiativtagande med ett lösningsorienterat mindset. Du tar stort eget ansvar och du bidrar till ständiga förbättringar inom ditt specialistområde. Du tar för dig, identifierar arbetsuppgifter & behov hos Norteams kunder och du är duktig på att strukturera och prioritera ditt arbete.


Vi tror också att du har en affärsmässig skärpa och helhetsblick som skapar förutsättningar att inte bara arbeta tekniskt, utan även att kunna bidra till utveckling av Norteams produkter & tjänster inom Microsoft Cloud.


Vi värdesätter också nyfikenhet & utvecklingsvilja – en drivkraft att utveckla din kompetens, omsätta ny kunskap i praktiken och inspirera kollegor genom att dela med dig av insikter och idéer.

**Du bör ha:**

* Erfarenhet av olika public cloud-miljöer (Azure/AWS/GCP)
* Certifieringar såsom AZ-104, AZ-204 och AZ-305
* Erfarenhet av M365-lösningar såsom Intune, säkerhet och identitetshantering
* Erfarenhet av olika nätverkslösningar
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla och paketera nya produkter & tjänster
* Erfarenhet av Azure Landing Zones, Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Bicep)
* Mycket god svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift

**Ett stort plus om du också har:**

* Erfarenhet av datamigrering
* Erfarenhet av övervakning & larmhantering såsom NOC och/eller SOC
* Erfarenhet av Automation & scripting
* Erfarenhet av Certifikathantering & PKI
* Erfarenhet av ITIL-processer, primärt Change Management

**Övrigt**

* Placeringsort är Stockholm, Bromma
* Arbete till största del från kontoret, med möjlighet till hybrid-lösning
* Start så snart som möjligt

**Vad erbjuder vi?**

* En dynamisk och utvecklande miljö med engagerade kollegor
* Gemensamma aktiviteter, tävlingar och årlig konferensresa utomlands
* Frihet att välja de verktyg du behöver för att lyckas
* Eget gym, friskvård och generösa sociala ytor på kontoret
* Tjänstepension, föräldralön och sjukvårdsförsäkring

Möjlighet att påverka och vara med på vår tillväxtresa  
* 

**Redo att ta nästa steg?**


Skicka in din ansökan eller hör av dig för ett förutsättningslöst samtal – vi är alltid nyfikna på nya stjärnor! Urvalet sker löpande, så vänta inte för länge.


För frågor om Norteam eller rollen – kontakta David von Grothusen. Talent Acquisition Lead på Norteam, david.von.grothusen@norteam.se.

 **Välkommen till Norteam – IT can be more!**

**Hur bedömer du din erfarenhet av optimering, felsökning och optimering av olika typer av nätverkslösningar?**

title: Mobile Core Operations Engineers
description:
**Looking for a workplace for the future?**  

  

At Telenor, you own your career. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to make the most of your dreams and expertise while contributing to technological innovations that are barely even imagined today. Innovations that we know will change the map for how we communicate and live our connected lives in the future. Are you looking for a workplace where you can make a difference in what matters most – relationships between people? Then you are welcome to Telenor.


We are now looking for two **Mobile Core Operations Engineers** to join our **Mobile Core** team.

**About the team**


Mobile communications have entered the fifth generation, and the demand for fast, reliable, and secure mobile services continues to grow across society. We already serve millions of users who depend on our network every day—and with the evolution of true 5G, mobile connectivity will become even more critical.


At the heart of this transformation is the Mobile Core: the central component where most services are created, managed, and delivered. The pace of innovation in this area is rapid—traditional network “boxes” have evolved into cloud-native, data center-based solutions.


Our Mobile Core team is responsible for both development and 24/7 operations across the entire domain. This includes architecture and design, fault and change management, performance monitoring, testing, automation, troubleshooting, and more. We work in agile teams, adapting in size depending on the task, and always strive to match the right expertise to the right challenge.

**About the role**


As a member of the Mobile Core team, you’ll play a key role in ensuring our network remains robust, scalable, and always available. Your responsibilities will include:

* Participating in the design and implementation of new Mobile Core features and services
* Monitoring and analyzing network performance to proactively identify and resolve issues
* Managing incidents and troubleshooting faults in a mission-critical, 24/7 environment
* Driving automation and continuous improvement across operations and workflows
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and delivery
* Contributing to testing, validation, and deployment of new releases and upgrades


This is more than just a technical role—it’s an opportunity to shape the future of mobile communications and make a real impact on the services millions rely on every day.

**Are you the one we’re looking for?**


We need someone who’s always on their toes! You have a genuine desire to learn and develop so we can continue to meet our customers’ ever-changing needs – today and tomorrow.


We’re looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative setting and is passionate about mobile technology. You are familiar with some of the following areas, either from studies or from work life. Expertise in all of them is not expected:

**Technologies & Infrastructure**

* Operating systems (Linux)
* Containers, microservices and orchestration (Kubernetes, Docker)
* IP Networking (DNS/Firewall/Routing), Open vSwitch, NGINX, Container Networking interfaces
* Hyperconverged Storage Solutions (Ceph/Rook)
* Mobile Networks (3GPP knowledge)
  

**Automation**

* Configuration Management (Git, Helm, YAML)
* Software supply chain CI/CD (Jenkins)
* Logging (Fluentd)
* Fault Management (Alert Manager)
* Scripting and Programming (Bash, Python)
* Metrics Collection and visualization (Grafana, Prometheus, Victoria Metrics)
* Continuous testing tools / Test automation
* DevSecOps practices


Experience from Ericsson cloud native systems is a bonus.

**Apply today!**


Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application! We review applicants on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait—reach out today.


If you have any questions or want to know more, feel free to contact the hiring manager Kenneth Radebo at kenneth.radebo@telenor.se. Please note that we cannot accept applications via email.

**Our promise to you**

**We are better together.**


Here, you’ll be part of a family-like and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other’s backs through ups and downs.

**We support relationships and societies.**

Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.

**We make room for life.**

Work from home up to two days a week, if your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. Leadership based on trust and flexible working hours helps you balance work and life. We support you through every stage of life with our benefit package, including collective agreements, occupational pensions, wellness allowances, and customized insurance solutions tailored to your needs.


**We invite you to a career in motion.**

Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you’ll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. If you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.


**Good to know**


As part of Telenor’s policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments. This role will require Swedish security clearance. On-call duties is a part of this position.

title: Technology & Architecture Lead
description:
Description


Welcome to SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, the perfect workplace for those passionate about technology in general and space in particular.
With space organizations, research institutes, institutional and commercial actors as customers, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications, space consulting services, rocket and balloon systems, flight test services, satellite propulsion systems, and much more.


SSC also has one of the world’s largest global networks of ground stations for satellite communications. We own and operate the Esrange Space Center in Kiruna, northern Sweden, with the aim of launching satellites in the near future.

**Are you ready to take the lead in shaping the technical future of SSC?**

**We are now looking for a Technology & Architecture Lead to join our Group IT team.**


Requirements


**YOUR ROLE**
In this key position, you will take overall responsibility for shaping and strengthening SSC’s technology landscape, spanning infrastructure, cloud, workplace, security, and software development. Reporting directly to the CIO and serving as a member of the Global IT management team, you will act as the connecting link that ensures our technical environment truly supports SSC’s long-term mission and business ambitions.


As a trusted advisor to the CIO and divisional leaders, you will translate business goals into modern, sustainable and secure technology solutions. You will help set priorities, challenge existing structures where needed and drive continuous improvement throughout the organization.


This position is ideal for someone who enjoys combining strategic thinking with practical execution. You are a confident technical leader who builds trust through deep expertise, collaboration and sound judgment.

**You will also:**

* Set the overall technical direction for SSC’s IT and software environments, ensuring coherence across all domains.
* Lead our Cloud First journey and drive modernization initiatives across SSC’s divisions.
* Advise the CIO ,and senior leadership on architecture, prioritization and technology investments.
* Promote collaboration between IT, software development and business functions to ensure aligned and sustainable solutions.
* Ensure compliance with NIS2, ISO 27001, and SSC policies.
* Safeguard technical integrity by ensuring quality, security and scalability in everything we deliver.


Responsibilities


**WHO YOU ARE**
You are an experienced technical leader who thrives at the intersection of strategy and execution. You enjoy creating clarity in complex environments and know how to balance innovation with structure.  

You can communicate equally well with developers and executives and have the confidence to guide others through change.

**We believe you have:**

* A solid background (15+ years) in IT infrastructure, cloud, or software engineering leadership.
* Deep understanding of how software and infrastructure come together in modern, cloud-based ecosystems (preferably AWS).
* Proven ability to lead across diverse technical domains and integrate governance with execution.
* Experience in complex in-house developed systems and cloud transformations.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Experience from technically advanced or regulated industries such as aerospace, defense, or telecommunications is highly valued.


Benefits


**WE OFFER YOU**  

* A unique opportunity to contribute to a wide range of projects and play an active role in both the Swedish and international space industry.
* An excellent opportunity for personal and career development.
* An exciting, international workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world.

 **LOCATION**  

This is a full-time, permanent position based at our office in Solna, with the possibility to work in a hybrid setup.

 **FURTHER INFORMATION**


For questions regarding employment terms or union-related matters, you are welcome to contact our union representatives:  

**Sveriges Ingenjörer**: SverigesIngenjorer-AF@sscspace.com  

**Unionen**: unionen@sscspace.com

 **NEXT STEP**


If this opportunity sparks your interest, don’t wait to apply! Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis, and interviews will be conducted continuously. We kindly ask you to submit your CV when applying. While you are welcome to include a brief personal note or letter, our evaluation will primarily focus on your skills and qualifications as outlined in your CV, ensuring a fair and unbiased recruitment process.


Please note that the job advertisement may close earlier than the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications. This allows us to ensure a fair and efficient recruitment process and give each application the attention it deserves.

  

  

This is a security-classified position and will require a background check prior to employment.


We welcome your application no later than 2025-11-30. **WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE**


Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.


With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.


 We help Earth benefit from Space. Learn more at sscspace.com
