title: Fullstack Engineer (Web + Backend)
description:
### **Beskrivning**


Vi söker en erfaren Fullstack Engineer (Web + Backend) som vill vara en central del i utvecklingen av vår klients autentiseringslösningar – från användarregistrering till inloggning och säker identitetshantering. Rollen passar dig som trivs i en miljö med höga tekniska krav, stort ansvar och möjlighet att påverka systemdesign och arkitektur. Du kommer att samarbeta med kollegor i ett internationellt och distribuerat team där kvalitet, säkerhet och prestanda står i fokus.

### **Arbetsuppgifter**


Som Fullstack Engineer kommer du att arbeta med utveckling och vidareutveckling av både backend och frontend-komponenter i vår klients autentiseringsplattform. Du ansvarar för att designa, implementera och optimera lösningar i Java, samt bidra till webbutveckling i JavaScript och Next.js. Arbetet innebär stort inslag av systemdesign, arkitektur och tekniskt ledarskap. Du deltar aktivt i kodgranskningar, tekniska diskussioner och beslutsfattande kring plattformens framtida riktning.

### **Kvalifikationer**

**Krav:**

* Minst 8 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Java och backend-arkitektur
* Erfarenhet av JavaScript och Next.js
* Förmåga att arbeta både strategiskt och operativt i tekniska projekt
* God samarbetsförmåga och vana att arbeta i distribuerade, multikulturella team
* Flytande engelska i tal och skrift

**Meriterande:**

* Erfarenhet av Kubernetes
* Erfarenhet av Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Kunskap om OAuth och identitetshantering
* Erfarenhet av storskaliga, konsumentinriktade applikationer

### **Villkor**


Arbetstider: Dagtid, måndag till fredag  

Tjänstgöringsgrad: Heltid, 100%  

Plats: Stockholm (arbete på plats)  

Period: 2025-11-17 – 2026-05-31


Om du är redo att ta dig an en nyckelroll i utvecklingen av säkra och moderna autentiseringslösningar – skicka in din ansökan redan idag!  

Bifoga CV som tydligt visar att du har den kompetens och erfarenhet som efterfrågas.  

Vi behandlar ansökningar löpande och ser fram emot att höra från dig.

**Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post på grund av GDPR.**  

**För att din ansökan ska kunna behandlas ber vi dig därför att skicka in den via vår** **karriärsida**

title: Communication & Project Manager
description:
**Date:** Nov 7, 2025


**Location:** Malmö, SE


**Company:** AkzoNobel


Nordsjö Idé & Design butiker inspirerar och levererar hög service med fokus på färg av hög kvalitet till konsumenter och den professionella målaren. Butikerna säljer även tapet, golv och inredningstillbehör. Nordsjö Idé & Design butikerna ägs av AkzoNobel Decorative Coatings AB och som består av över 100 butiker i Sverige från Trelleborg i söder till Kiruna i norr, som till största del drivs och ägs av franchisetagare.

  


*Har du passion för kommunikation, koordinering & utveckling av digitala lösningar? Har du kunskaper inom olika verktyg inom marknadsföring? Vi söker nu en Communication & Project Manager till vårt kontor i Malmö.*

  

**Vad kan AkzoNobel erbjuda dig?**



Hos oss på AkzoNobel möts du av en varm och välkomnande atmosfär, där vi tillsammans arbetar med fokus på innovation och hållbarhet, för att nå målet att vara världsledande inom färgindustrin. Mångfald berikar våra arbetsplatser och vi arbetar aktivt tillsammans med våra medarbetare för att de ska trivas och utvecklas. Vi arbetar strategiskt för att bli en bättre arbetsgivare. Detta resulterar bland annat i att vi är utnämnda till ett av Sveriges Karriärföretag och har fått Top Employer certifiering 2025. Vi erbjuder dig en internationell arbetsmiljö där du får ta dig an givande och utmanande arbetsuppgifter som vidgar dina vyer och utvecklar dig i din roll. Du kommer att arbeta med kompetenta och likasinnade kollegor som delar din inställning och entusiasm. Välkommen till oss!

  

**Vad kommer du att arbeta med?**



I rollen som Communication & Project Manager innebär det att du är ansvarig för kommunikationen till våra butiker och kunder Sverige, men även ansvarig för flera viktiga projekt. Dina huvuduppgifter innebär följande:

  


* Proaktivt samla, koordinera, distribuera och föra dialog för att förenkla den dagliga verksamheten i våra butiker, genom bland annat intranät och nyhetsbrev.
* Uppdatering och utveckling av hemsida, intranät och andra plattformar.
* Arbeta i InDesign och Photoshop för att ta fram material som är både visuellt tilltalande och funktionellt
* Ansvara för att ta fram tryckfärdiga original och säkerställa att filer uppfyller tryckeriets tekniska krav
* Samarbeta med kollegor kring idéer, koncept och grafiska uttryck
* Planera och verkställa vår årliga konferens, där vi samlar och för dialog med butiker och leverantörer
* Uppdatera och säkerställa butiksregister med relevant information
* Dokumentera rutiner och processer

  



Tjänsten är en tillsvidare, med start i januari. Du kommer vara placerad på vårt kontor i Arlöv och rapportera till kedjechef.

  


**Vem är du?**



Som person är du öppen, prestigelös och positiv. Du har ett stort engagemang och ser helheten i det du gör, är en ”doer” men samtidigt noggrann och analytisk. Du har fallenhet för att kommunicera på ett tydligt och pedagogiskt sätt såväl muntligt som skriftligt och trivs i rollen med att skapa många kontaktytor.

  



För att du ska bli framgångsrik i rollen ser vi att du idag arbetar med liknande arbete såsom projektledning, koordinering, support, produktion av tryckfärdigt material och administration. Du har stor kunskap och erfarenhet av att hantera och utveckla hemsidor samt intranät. Vi ser gärna att du har en utbildning inom kommunikation och marknad. Du bör ha goda kunskaper av MS Office, Wordpress, Google Analytics, Adobe InDesign och Photoshop. Meriterande är även om du har kunskaper inom Adobe Creative Cloud. Du är noggrann och har känsla för detaljer i layout, typografi och färghantering. Du är flytande i svenska, i både tal och skrift. Har du kunskap av övriga nordiska språk är det meriterande.

  


**Din ansökan**



På AkzoNobel är vi mycket engagerade i att säkerställa en inkluderande och respektfull arbetsplats där alla våra anställda kan vara sitt bästa jag. Vi strävar efter att omfamna mångfald, tolerans och respekt. Vår rekryteringsprocess spelar en stor roll i denna resa eftersom den lägger grunden för en mångsidig arbetsmiljö. I vår organisation behandlas alla kvalificerade sökande ur ett jämlikt och jämställt perspektiv – utan hänsyn till etniskt ursprung, religion, kön, könsidentitet, sexuell läggning, ålder eller funktionshinder.

  



Tveka inte, ta steget och lämna in din ansökan redan idag för din chans att få jobba tillsammans med oss! Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande och tar tyvärr inte emot ansökningar via email.

  



För ytterligare information om tjänsten, vänligen kontakta Niclas Nilsson, kedjechef, +46 708 35 52 68  

För mer information om rekryteringsprocessen, vänligen kontakta Samuel Johannesson, Talent Acquisition Partner Nordics, samuel.johannesson@akzonobel.com
company_description: AkzoNobel is a leading global paints and coatings company. With brands such as Flexa, Sikkens and International, we deliver sustainable and innovative solutions in more than 150 countries.

title: Product Quality Specialist to FA Solutions
description:
Join a team dedicated to quality and innovation in fintech. As a Product Quality Specialist at FA Solutions, you’ll ensure our platform delivers true value and reliability to clients worldwide.

**About FA Solutions**  

FA Solutions is a leading fintech company providing a cloud-based investment management platform trusted by financial institutions worldwide. We combine technological excellence with deep industry expertise to deliver innovative, scalable solutions for our clients. At FA Solutions, you will be part of an international team that values professionalism, collaboration, and continuous growth. Together, we enable smarter finance.

**About the role**  

In this role, you will take full ownership of manual testing and business acceptance testing, verifying that new features, improvements, and fixes meet both specifications and client requirements. You’ll collaborate closely with Product Owners, developers, and QA Engineers to plan and execute testing for upcoming releases, ensuring smooth, high-quality deliveries.


You will also support Product Owners in defining specifications and gathering requirements, while helping colleagues across the organization understand product functionalities. With your analytical mindset and strong business understanding, you identify areas of improvement and contribute to the overall usability and value of our platform.

**Key responsibilities**  

Your main tasks include:

* Planning and performing manual testing for new features, improvements, and fixes
* Ensuring that changes meet specifications, client business needs, and usability standards
* Conducting end-to-end testing and preparing test cases for larger development projects
* Participating in acceptance testing before releases
* Cooperating with the QA team to support test automation
* Assisting Product Owners in requirement gathering and specification work
* Helping internal teams understand and utilize product functionalities
* Suggesting future improvements and maintaining high quality standards

**Your profile**  

To succeed in this role, you are detail-oriented, analytical, and passionate about testing. You combine business understanding with technical insight and have experience working in a product or software environment. You thrive in a collaborative, cross-functional setting and take ownership of ensuring product quality from a user and business perspective.

**We expect you to have:**

* 5+ years of relevant experience in software testing, product quality, or related roles
* Solid understanding of both business and software processes
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Working knowledge of software development processes and user-centered design
* Understanding of the wealth and asset management domain and its processes
* Full working proficiency in English

**Beneficial (not required):**

* Experience with manual testing for functional accuracy, usability, and client alignment
* Basic programming knowledge

**About the application**  

In this recruitment process, FA Solutions is collaborating with Fincruit. For any questions regarding your application, please contact the responsible recruiter, Cecilia Lantz, at cecilia.lantz@fincruit.se or 073 997 22 79.

title: SecOps Engineer
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most. With strong backing, a flat organization, and bold growth plans, we’re now looking for a SecOps Engineer to join us and shape the future of small business owners.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a SecOps Engineer at Qred, you’ll be a part of the enabler team, supporting our compliance team and cross-functional teams, working in a modern technical stack. We don’t only talk about AWS, serverless and machine learning, we are heavily invested in it. You will advise, collaborate, code and break stuff. Your daily work will probably include the following:
   

  

* You’ll be ensuring strong security in all aspects of platform operations.
* Supporting product teams in their ability to build and secure cloud distributed systems, serverless architectures and container platforms.
* Supporting IT with client security configuration, alerting and response
* Work with internal and external stakeholders to identify the company needs and requirements and implement the best practices in house.
* Be awesome and hands-on with AWS, IaC, tooling and coding/scripting (python or nodejs).
* Work with product teams to help drive security projects.
* Coordinate any security related issue, both planned and unplanned.
* Security audits of our integrations
* Troubleshooting and support of anything that touches our security related systems for the entire company
* Be or want to be knowledgeable on relevant compliance with technical touchpoints for our industry, EBA ICT guidelines or DORA compliance as an example.


**Here’s what we're looking for:**
* A self-driven person with a flexible, positive mindset and strong team spirit, who loves helping others.
* You can write secure code in at least one language (we use Python and Typescript) and are familiar with secure coding practices (e.g., OWASP).
* You have a passion for breaking (and fixing) stuff. You see what others don’t.
* At least a few years of experience working with security and/or cloud ops.
* Solid work experience in AWS and security, preferably in serverless.
* You’ve worked in regulated, compliant environments.
* If you have an AWS certification (Developer, Solution Architect or Sysops) we’ll be extra interested!


**Why join us?**
 Qred is growing fast, and our Qredsters along with it. With a non-bureaucratic organization and delegated responsibilities, we make sure there’s a short path from idea to action. In addition to our great culture, you get to work with the latest cutting-edge techniques offered by AWS, responsibility for the whole cloud architecture, and last but not least a bunch of new competent colleagues to learn from!
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. While we encourage a hybrid and flexible work setup, we do expect you to be in the office three days per week. Ideally, the role would be filled as soon as possible, but we’re happy to agree on a mutually suitable start date for the right candidate.
   

  

*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*
 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Solutions Architect
description:
**TL;DR -** 
 We’re looking for a Solutions Architect to bridge product depth with business outcomes at Lovable. You’ll help customers understand how Lovable fits into their architecture, design solutions that win enterprise trust, and partner with Sales, Product, and Engineering to drive adoption of AI-native software creation.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with any language. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* Experience in solutions architecture or sales engineering at a high-growth startup
* Deep understanding of technical architectures, APIs, integrations, data flows, and cloud infrastructure
* Strong consultative selling skills – able to map product capabilities to customer pain points and ROI
* Skilled at communicating complex technical concepts simply to both engineering and executive audiences
* Builder mindset – you enjoy creating scalable processes, proof-of-concepts, and reusable frameworks
* Collaborative partner to Sales, Product, and Engineering, ensuring tight feedback loops
* Bonus: experience with AI platforms, developer tools, or enterprise integrations


**What You’ll Do**
* Partner with Sales to lead technical discovery, solution design, and customer evaluation cycles
* Architect Lovable solutions that align with customer goals and technical constraints
* Develop repeatable frameworks for demos, proofs-of-value, and implementation design
* Collaborate with Product and Engineering to influence roadmap priorities and strengthen technical narratives
* Build and maintain technical enablement materials for pre-sales execution
* Serve as Lovable’s technical voice in key enterprise deals, building trust through depth and clarity


**How We Hire**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.
* Discuss your experience in more depth during a round of interviews with us.
* Join us for a workshop lasting 1-2 days remote or onsite. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal.

title: Tech lead/Solution Architect
description:
Why Valtech? We’re the experience innovation company - a trusted partner to the world’s most recognized brands. To our people we offer growth opportunities, a values-driven culture, international careers and the chance to shape the future of experience.
   

  

**The opportunity**
 At Valtech, you’ll find an environment designed for continuous learning, meaningful impact, and professional growth. Whether you're pioneering new digital solutions, challenging conventional thinking or building the next generation of customer experiences, your work will help transform industries.
   

  

**We Are Proud Of**
* The work we do and the innovation we drive
* Our values of share, care and dare
* A workplace culture that fosters creativity, diversity and autonomy
* Our borderless, global framework, which enables seamless collaboration


**The role**
 As a
 **Tech lead/Solution Architect** 
 , you are passionate about experience innovation and eager to push the boundaries of what’s possible. You bring experience, a growth mindset and a drive to make a lasting impact.
   

  

**You Will Thrive In This Role If You Are**
* A curious problem solver who challenges the status quo
* A collaborator who values teamwork and knowledge-sharing
* Excited by the intersection of technology, creativity and data
* Experienced in Agile methodologies and consulting (a plus)


**The Role**
 Valtech is looking for a Tech Lead/Solution Architect with deep experience within platform implementations. Are you passionate about creating and implementing innovative digital solutions? Are you enthusiastic about delving into the evolving trends and technologies? Are you based in Stockholm with ability to be onsite at our local office or at our clients? Then you might be the person we are looking for! Keep reading to find out.
   

  

**A day in the life of a Tech Lead/Solution Architect**
 As an expert, you fulfil a unique and rewarding role as both a consultant/client advisor, and a technical leader. You will shape and participate in every stage of new and ongoing client engagements, from pre-sales, discovery to delivery, collaborating within both regional project teams and our global craft circle.
   

  

 You will also actively participate in the pre-sales process, contributing to pitches and client presentations. Leveraging your technical expertise, you'll effectively communicate how the platform solutions align with client needs and objectives, ensuring a seamless transition from initial discussions to project execution.
   

  

**More Specifically, You Will**
* Engage with our clients' stakeholders from both IT and Business aligning our solutions to provide business value
* Define and implement scalable and resilient solutions, ensuring alignment with business objectives and industry best practices
* Collaborate with and lead cross-functional teams in designing and integrating complex backend systems, including CMS, with diverse external systems and services
* Design architectures that can leverage AI technologies, such as machine learning APIs, natural language processing, and predictive analytics, to create smarter, more adaptive digital experiences
* Champion architectural decisions and provide mentorship to development teams, fostering a culture of innovation, quality, and collaboration
* Proactively identify performance bottlenecks and technical challenges, developing strategies to optimize application responsiveness and efficiency
* Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in the digital landscape


**You and the role**
 You are likely someone with 10+ years of experience in backend development and have experience leading the work of developing the solution architecture for digital solutions in close dialog with clients. You have a good communicate skills and know how to identify additional ways your team can add value. You thrive in fast-paced, agile environment and are eager to contribute to a team that values innovation, creativity, and quality.
   

  

**We would love if you have**
* Proven experience as a Backend Developer at a Lead or Architect level
* Strong knowledge of.NET / .NET Core framework (C#), API driven development and Privacy by Design
* Experience with CMS including content modelling, personalization, and e-commerce integration
* Proficiency in SQL, and experience with database design and development
* Experience with cloud (Azure) and DevOps practices
* Experience in developing and implementing optimization strategies for complex digital ecosystems
* Experience in leading architectural design for enterprise projects, proficiency in enterprise architecture frameworks, and preferably relevant certifications validating professional development.
* Experience of working across multiple disciplines and with international, distributed, and multicultural project teams.
* Fluent written and spoken communication skills in English and Swedish.


**Bonus If You Have Experience With**
* Applying AI frameworks or services
* Integrating chatbots, recommendation engines, or other AI-powered features into customer journeys
* Defining data strategies that support machine learning and AI development within enterprise architectures


**What you Can Expect From Us**
 At Valtech you’ll become part of our exceptional team of more than 8,000 talented innovators, design thinkers, marketers, creatives, and engineers. We interact across countries, disciplines, trades, roles and teams. We are consultants before anything else and take ownership of our own work, clients, and careers.
   

  

 We provide everyone with a large degree of freedom - in return, we expect an equally high degree of accountability and dedication. We transform by doing and are insanely passionate about improving the end user experience. We are a people company.
   

  

 We share our knowledge and learnings; we dare to speak up and take risks. And we care deeply about one another, our clients, and the world around us. We have from our very beginning always worked hard on providing everyone within our organization the opportunity to grow and transform their job opportunities and career paths across the world.
   

  

 From graduates to seasoned professionals who are experts in their field. Valtech will always be recognized not just for the quality of the work we deliver, but for all the amazing people that make it happen. We don’t just talk about how to get things done; we really do transform by doing.
   

  

**The Benefits**
 This is a permanent position based in
 **Stockholm, Sweden** 
 .
   

  

**Beyond a Competitive Compensation Package, We Offer**
* Flexibility, with remote and hybrid work options (country-dependent)
* Career advancement, with international mobility and professional development programs
* Learning and development, with access to cutting-edge tools, training and industry experts


 Our benefits are tailored to each location. Your Talent Partner will provide full details during the hiring process.
   

  

**Your application process**
 Once you apply, our Talent Acquisition team will review your application. If your skills and experience align with the role, we’ll reach out for next steps.
   

  

 ⚠️ Beware of recruitment fraud: Only engage with official Valtech email addresses ending in @valtech.com.
   

  

 We are committed to inclusion and accessibility. If you need reasonable accommodations during the interview process, please either indicate it in your application or let your Talent Partner know.
   

  

**About Valtech**
 Valtech is the experience innovation company that exists to unlock a better way to experience the world. By blending crafts, categories, and cultures, we help brands unlock new value in an increasingly digital world.
   

  

 At the intersection of data, AI, creativity, and technology, we drive transformation for leading organizations, including L’Oréal, Audi, P&G, Volkswagen, OKQ8, Arlanda Express, Audi, P&G, Volkswagen and more.
   

  

 At Valtech, we don’t just talk about transformation. We make it happen. Our people are the heart of our success, and we foster a workplace where everyone has the support to thrive, grow and innovate.
   

  

 Are you ready to create what’s next? Join us.

title: Observability Specialist
description:
**Job Description**
 De säger att "det är inte raketvetenskap." Vi håller inte med.
   

  

 Välkommen till SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, den perfekta arbetsplatsen för dig som brinner för teknik i allmänhet och rymden i synnerhet.
   

  

 Med rymdorganisationer, forskningsinstitut, institutionella och kommersiella aktörer som kunder, erbjuder vi specialistkompetens inom satellitkommunikation, rymdkonsulttjänster, raket- och ballongsystem, flygtesttjänster, framdrivningssystem för satelliter och mycket mer.
   

  

 SSC har dessutom ett av världens största globala nätverk av markstationer för satellitkommunikation. Vi äger och driver rymdbasen Esrange i Kiruna i norra Sverige, med sikte att i närtid kunna skjuta upp satelliter.
   

  

 Är du driven av en passion för människor och med ambitionen att skapa en fantastisk arbetsplats? Är du redo att ge dig ut på en spännande resa med oss för att hjälpa jorden att dra nytta av rymden?
   

  

 Om du svarar ja på dessa frågor, uppmanar vi dig att ta chansen att göra verklig skillnad som vår Observability Specialist.
   

  

 Vi söker en driven person som delar våra kärnvärden: Kundfokus, Omtanke, Samarbete, Nyfikenhet och Mod.
   

  

 På SSC är observability inte bara en lyx – det är avgörande. Våra system stödjer tidskritiska uppdrag och vetenskapliga operationer, och vi behöver full insyn för att säkerställa att de fungerar pålitligt och säkert.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en Observability Specialist som kan hjälpa oss att se allt från loggar, mätvärden och spårningar till alla dolda signaler som håller våra plattformar friska, både lokalt och i AWS. Det här är en unik möjlighet att ta ett helhetsgrepp om SSC:s övervakning genom att forma strategin, välja verktygen och bygga upp en modern observability-plattform som blir en gemensam tjänst för hela organisationen. Här får du stort inflytande över både teknik och arbetssätt, och en central roll i att bygga en funktion som används av både IT och våra tekniska divisioner. Du äger området observability och driver det framåt tillsammans med kollegor som delar ditt engagemang för tillförlitliga system, utveckling och långsiktiga lösningar.
   

  

**Job Requirements**
 DIN ROLL
   

  

 Som Observability Specialist utvecklar och implementerar du de verktyg och ramverk som gör våra system observerbara. Från loggar och mätvärden till spårning och dashboards ser du till att våra plattformar är väl instrumenterade, övervakade och optimerade för prestanda och tillförlitlighet.
   

  

**Vad Du Kommer Att Göra**
* Designa och drifta övervakningslösningar (t.ex. Grafana, Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, CloudWatch)
* Definiera standarder för loggning, mätvärden och spårning
* Skapa dashboards och larm som verkligen gör skillnad
* Stötta team i att instrumentera tjänster för observability
* Undersöka incidenter med hjälp avobservability-data och verktyg
* Vägleda bästa praxis för loggstruktur, lagring och kostnadshantering
* Stötta efterlevnad och revision kopplat till övervakning
* Samarbeta med DevOps och SecOps för att integrera observability i leveranspipelines
* APM –Application Performance Monitoring
* Implementera Incident Management-processer inom O11Y-stacken, t.ex. Prometheus, JIRA, PagerDuty.


**Job Responsibilities**
 VEM DU ÄR
   

  

 Du är nyfiken och vill förstå hur system fungerar i detalj och trivs med att analysera vad som händer när något går fel. Du arbetar praktiskt och söker alltid förbättringar bortom "good enough". Du bygger observability inte bara för att övervaka, utan för att förstå och agera. Du bidrar med struktur, samarbete och tydlig kommunikation i det dagliga arbetet, och är bekväm med att navigera både på svenska och engelska i en professionell miljö.
   

  

**Vad Vi Söker**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av övervakning och loggning i moln-eller hybridmiljöer
* God vana vid att konfigurera AWS-tjänster inom detta område
* Erfarenhet av verktyg som Grafana, Loki, Prometheus, Cloud Watch eller ELK
* Förståelse för principer kring mätvärden, loggar och distribuerad spårning
* Bekantskap med SLO:er, larmstrategier och incidenthanteringsprocesser.


**Vi Värdesätter Erfarenhet Inom**
* OpenTelemetry eller andra observability-ramverk
* Bakgrund inom SRE,DevOpseller plattformsutveckling
* AWS-certifiering(ar).


**Job Benefits**
 VI ERBJUDER DIG
   

  

* En av världens mest spännande och snabbast växande branscher inom rymdbranschen.
* En spännande och dynamisk arbetsplats med medarbetare och kunder över hela världen.
* Utrymme att utvecklas i takt med företagets tillväxt och framtidsmål.
* 30 dagars semester samt traditionella helgdagar – vi erbjuder dessutom extra lediga dagar.
* Utöver semester och traditionella helgdagar erbjuder vi extra betald ledighet under året, såsom ledigt mellan jul och nyår,Kristi himmelsfärdsdag– totalt 6–11 extra dagar beroende på kalendern.
* Friskvårdsbidrag (5 000 SEK/år).
* Attraktiv tjänstepension (ITP) och möjlighet att löneväxla till pension.
* En internationell arbetsplats som präglas av en öppen atmosfär och ett utmanande arbetsklimat i ständig utveckling.


 PLACERING
   

  

 Detta är en tillsvidareanställning på 40 timmar/vecka, med placering på vårt kontor i Solna Strand.
   

  

  

  

 MER INFORMATION
   

  

 Vid frågor som rör anställningsvillkor eller fackliga frågor är du välkommen att kontakta våra fackliga representanter:
   

  

 Sveriges Ingenjörer: af@sscspace.com
   

  

 Unionen: unionen@sscspace.com
   

  

  

  

 NÄSTA STEG
   

  

 Om denna möjlighet väcker ditt intresse så är du varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande och intervjuer genomförs under processens gång. Vänligen bifoga ditt CV i samband med ansökan. Du har möjlighet att komplettera med ett personligt brev, men vår bedömning kommer i första hand att utgå från din kompetens och erfarenhet som framgår av CV:t, i syfte att säkerställa en rättvis och objektiv rekryteringsprocess.
   

  

 Observera att annonsen kan komma att stängas i förtid om vi får in ett stort antal ansökningar, för att kunna säkerställa en effektiv process och ge varje kandidat rättvis uppmärksamhet.
   

  

  

  

 Detta är en säkerhetsklassad position och kommer att kräva en bakgrundskontroll före anställning.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan till och med 2025-12-08.
   

  

  

  

 VI HJÄLPER JORDEN ATT DRA NYTTA AV RYMDEN
   

  

 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) är en ledande global leverantör av avancerade rymdtjänster med mer än 50 års erfarenhet. Vi hjälper rymdorganisationer, forskningsinstitut, kommersiella och institutionella aktörer från hela världen att få tillgång till rymden.
   

  

 Med lokal närvaro på alla kontinenter och cirka 700 engagerade medarbetare erbjuder vi specialistkompetens inom satellitkommunikation och satellitkontrolltjänster, rymdfarkostoperationer, raket- och ballongsystem, uppskjutningstjänster och flygtesttjänster, samt ingenjörs-, drift- och konsulttjänster för rymduppdrag.
   

  

 We help Earth benefit from space. Läs mer på sscspace.com

title: Fullstackutvecklare
description:
Vill du vara en del av ett långsiktigt uppdrag där ditt arbete gör verklig skillnad i samhället? Har du förmågan att förstå och stödja verksamheten genom strategiska och tekniska lösningar? Då kan detta vara rätt utmaning för dig.
   

  

 Vi söker minst två fullstackutvecklare med gedigen kompetens inom antingen .NET eller Java, kombinerat med React och Typescript på frontend-sidan.
   

  

**Vad gör vi?**
 Vi på Decerno är specialister på skräddarsydda digitala lösningar och är stolta över att våra uppdrag bidrar till samhällsnytta.
   

  

 Det betyder att vi förstår att alla kunder är olika och har unika förutsättningar. Vi skräddarsyr våra lösningar utefter kundens behov vilket medför att vi kan erbjuda våra medarbetare ett smörgåsbord av spännande projekt och tekniker.
   

  

 Samtidigt som vi skapar digitala lösningar vill vi också göra skillnad på riktigt. Det är inte bara något vi säger, vi menar det! Sedan vår start 1984 har vår etiska policy varit vår kompass och vi väljer aktivt bort projekt inom vapenindustri, spel, tobak och alkohol.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som utvecklare hos oss kommer får du en varierad vardag och möjlighet att jobba inom (men inte uteslutande med) utveckling främst i React, .NET/C#, Java, SQL eller Azure.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid att bemanna våra projekt med Decernos egna anställda och tillsammans delar ni med er av olika erfarenheter och hjälper varandra genom projektets alla faser.
   

  

 Placeringen är i Stockholm eller Göteborg och vi erbjuder en hybrid arbetsform. Vi tror på att kunna erbjuda våra medarbetare flexibilitet och möjligheten att balansera egna behov och förutsättningar med projektets krav. För den som är placerad i Göteborg kan resor till Stockholm förekomma. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

**Är det här du?**
* Du har ett intresse för fullstackutveckling
* Du har minst tre års erfarenhet av C#/.NET eller Java
* Du har minst tre års erfarenhet av React eller något annat modernt JavaScript-ramverk, gärna med god vana av TypeScript
* Du är flytande i svenska i såväl tal som skrift
* Du har en högskoleutbildning eller erfarenhet som motsvarar utbildningen


 Det är meriterande om du har tidigare erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med Azure, DevOps, integrationer, .NET web API, CSS, AI eller maskininlärning.
   

  

**Därför ska du välja** 
**Decerno**
 I våra medarbetarundersökningar blir det gång på gång tydligt att det är de fantastiska kollegorna, de roliga och utmanande projekten och möjligheten att kunna bidra till samhällsnytta som gör att våra medarbetare trivs så bra på Decerno.
   

  

 Sedan finns det också några ytterligare aspekter vilka vi ser som självklarheter:
   

  

* En flexibel arbetsplats med större frihet att planera vardagen för att få arbete och privatliv att gå ihop
* Extra föräldraförmåner eftersom vi tycker att familjen är viktigast
* Vi tycker att din kompetensutveckling är viktig! Därför anordnar vi interna utbildningar löpande i vår egen Dec Academy, gör satsningar inom AI, håller i bokcirklar och arrangerar årliga konferenser
* Vi vill att du ska må bra, trivas och ha roligt på arbetet och därför arrangerar vi regelbundet olika sociala aktiviteter, utmaningar och hälsotävlingar – såväl virtuellt som på plats


 Utöver detta erbjuder vi även ett brett förmånspaket som inkluderar bland annat friskvårdsbidrag och ett generöst försäkringspaket. Vi berättar gärna mer om du vill veta vad mer vi på Decerno skulle kunna erbjuda dig.
   

  

**Låter detta som ditt nästa steg i karriären?** 
  

  

 Vad kul! Då ser vi fram emot att läsa din ansökan så snart som möjligt.

title: Workday Module Lead
description:
**INTRODUCTION**
 Do you get excited when guiding organizations on the transformation of their HR processes based on the next generation of technology? Put your expertise to work as part of the world’s largest independent technology services provider and own the way as a trendsetter in Workday. We’re ready if you are.
   

  

**DEPARTMENT INTRODUCTION**
 The Accenture Workday Business Group is a leading partner to Workday worldwide and has a track record of implementing many of the most significant Workday projects. In addition, we take pride in advising and collaborating closely with our clients from early strategy discussions, through technology implementations and transformation programs, to support and operations. Learn more about our practice at www.accenture.com/workday.
   

  

**ARE YOU INTERESTED?**
 Do you want to work with global talent at the forefront of technological services and seek meaningful projects for top international businesses? At Accenture you have access to specifics trainings for your functional lead role. You will start with training -together with colleagues - and you will join seminars at various international locations. You will be primed, equipped and well-networked to tackle exciting projects.
   

  

 We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity.
   

  

 “Across the globe, one thing is universally true of the people of Accenture: We care deeply about what we do and the impact we have with our clients and with the communities in which we work and live. It is personal to all of us.” –
 **Julie Sweet, Accenture CEO**
**What We Offer:**
- Innovative large scale Workday projects

- A global network of talented and passionate colleagues

- Challenging work for some of the world's largest companies

- Extensive education programs and development opportunities

- Volunteering and career opportunities around the world

- A diverse and socially active workforce

- Flexible working hours and opportunity to work from home

- Friendly and social work environment

- Ability to craft your career based on your own aspirations.

**As a Workday Module Lead:**
**You'll be part of a team of advisory professionals who deliver more than just technology. From rapid deployments to complete transformations, you'll provide integrated, cloud-based HR solutions that put organizations on the fast track to a better way to work.**
**In this role, you will help our clients get the most out of their Workday investment by:**
- Collaborate with clients on industry standards and leading practices in both HCM and other Workday domains, contributing to functional solutions that meet client needs and objective and applying Workday and Accenture methodologies.

- Hosting workshops and leading discussions on topics in line with your area(s) of expertise, covering the touchpoints with other Workday functionalities.

- Independently leading your workstream and reporting on progress

- Ability to lead diverse and disparate teams and lead them through the implementation. Liaising closely with client counterparts, Accenture colleagues, and Workday to exceed client expectations

- Actively supporting innovation

**We are looking for experience in the following skills:**
- Proven experience implementing Workday HCM and/or other major modules, or relevant cloud/on-prem HR platforms

- Strong client-facing skills, with the ability to manage teams, projects, and stakeholder interactions effectively

- Ability to thrive in dynamic environments, delivering high-quality outcomes under competing priorities

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills, able to translate complex requirements into clear solutions

- Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, with professional fluency in English

  

  

**Set yourself apart:**
- Multiple Workday certifications, ideally spanning HCM and other modules (e.g., Advanced Compensation, Absence, Benefits, Talent & Performance)

- End-to-end implementation experience, with the ability to lead specific module workstreams

- Familiarity with Workday Data Migration tools and Security framework

- 2–5 years of professional Workday consulting experience

- Additional European language fluency (e.g., Swedish, Norwegian, Danish, Finnish, German, French, Spanish, Dutch)

title: Data Engineer
description:
**TL;DR** 
 - We want a data-obsessed engineer to build Lovable’s data and analytics muscle. You’ll work cross-functionally across all teams to empower everyone with the insights they need for data-driven decision making. Must combine serious coding skills with the ability to turn complex data into winning product bets.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* A strong engineer with serious data infrastructure chops
* 5+ years of experience building data platforms or 3+ years with startup experience
* Past experience building up data infrastructure and pipelines to dashboards, reports and insights
* Obsession with understanding why users do what they do
* Strong opinions about the best data platform tools
* Startup and ex-Founder experience is an asset, especially if you’ve built up the data platform from the ground up


**What You’ll Do**
* Design, build and maintain scalable data pipelines and infrastructure
* Develop and optimize data models, warehouses and lakes
* Ensure data quality, reliability and consistency through validation and monitoring tools
* Work cross functionally across teams to ensure they are data-driven and can leverage your data system


**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Frontend: React
* Backend: Golang and Rust
* Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, Many LLM providers
* DevOps & Tooling: Github Actions, Grafana, OTEL, infrastructure-as-code (Terraform)


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

**How We Hire**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an intro call with recruiter.
* Complete the general programming exercise.
* Show us how you approach problems during several technical interviews.
* Tell us about your most impressive project.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal

title: Sales Executive Risk Management Software
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About Digital Solutions**
 We provide engineering software tools and enterprise solutions for managing risk to improve safety and performance across industries, including the maritime, energy, and healthcare sectors. Research, development, implementations and partnerships with our customers have earned us the position as a trusted third-party vendor of software and services. We are accelerating the pace of transition toward the digitalization of systems and software-as-a-service (SaaS) solutions to give customers the efficiency and flexibility of the cloud, including the power and insights from advanced analytics.
   

  

**About The Role**
**Local Unit and Position Description:**
**Sales Executive** 
 is part of the Business Area Digital Solutions in DNV and the QHSE Product Line. Sales Manager QHSE reports to the Global Growth Manager. The Sales Manager QHSE is based out of
 **Sweden** 
 and will mainly cover the Swedish, Danish and Finnish market. Other markets can be actual as well following the revenue stream from existing clients and prospects.
   

  

**Are you commercially creative for solution based selling within QHSE?**
 DNV Software wants to further expand the client base in the Nordics for the Synergi Life application and to support our business growth in the areas of QHSE, Risk Management and non-conformance management. The successful candidate will be responsible for increasing the sales of the Synergi Life software in various industries. We are looking for a dynamic person with experience in software sales or similar. If you think you are the person to help us achieve our goals, we would like to hear from you.
   

  

**Areas Of Responsibility**
 The
 **Sales Executive** 
 will contribute to the unit’s goals for order intake, revenues, profitability, and market penetration in the Nordics by the following activities:
   

  

* Promote and sell the company’s existing software and services products by identifying and managing opportunities in targeted industries and geographies.
* Successfully and professionally manage the entire sales process in accordance with company systems and policies and manage RFx processes and other tender processes.
* Participate in sales forecasting and planning in an effective manner by:
* Consistently building and delivering an accurate opportunity pipeline.
* Assisting with executing short and long-range sales and marketing plans.
* Actively engage with the Sales team and other colleagues, sharing knowledge and ideas in support of profitable growth and customer success.
* Support and promote established relationships with industry and solution partners to maximize sales and sustain a leading position in the market.
* Meet or exceed the revenue target for our products and identify short-term as well as long-term business opportunities.
* Gather intelligence and obtain a clear and comprehensive understanding of the client's business issues and challenges.
* Lead and/or participate in contract negotiations.
* Use the CRM tool to manage and record all stages of the sales cycle.
* Develop and grow relationships within the global sales team and actively collaborate and share customer intelligence and opportunities.
* Participate in global sales team gatherings and sales initiatives.
* Other sales and business development activities as required, in support of company strategies and goals.


 Travel within Europe is part of the job.
   

  

**Deadline: 15/11/2025**
 What we offer
   

  

* Work with dedicated and competent colleagues with a high education and specialization level in an international environment.
* Strong company culture with emphasis on competence development & learning opportunities.
* Focus on work/life balance.
* Great colleagues who value teamwork and support.
* Enjoy attractive pension- and insurance schemes (we have a collective agreement), health care contributions and other local benefits.


 DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity.
   

  

**About You**
* Strong “hunter” mentality with a proven track record in solution-based software sales or similar fields.
* Solid market knowledge and a strong commercial mindset.
* Demonstrated ability to manage complex, multi-layered solution sales in large organizations.
* Proven success in industrial or technical sales, consistently meeting or exceeding targets.
* Advantageous: knowledge of Risk Management, Compliance, and HSEQ services.
* Familiarity with DNV Software and Synergi Life (preferred, not required).
* Experience using or promoting DNV Software or analysis tools in a business development environment.
* Creative and innovative in cross-functional selling; able to present professionally.
* Excellent communication skills in English and Swedish, both written and verbal.
* Strong interpersonal skills to build and maintain profitable, long-term customer relationships.
* Skilled in negotiation and closing, with a focus on sustainable, win-win outcomes.
* Ability and willingness to travel regionally and internationally.
* Proficient in software demonstrations or eager to continuously develop presentation skills.
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent qualification.


*Security and compliance with statutory requirements in the countries in which we operate is essential for DNV. Background checks will be conducted on all final candidates as part of the offer process, in accordance with applicable country-specific laws and practice.*

title: Embedded Test Automation Engineer
description:
You will have the opportunity to work with different cultures cross functionally, with internal as well as external stakeholders and therefore we see that you have good interpersonal and communication skills. Being fluent in English, spoken and written, is also important to succeed in this position. Other requirements that we also see as beneficiary but not limited to for the role are:
  
  

Experience in embedded Software development
  
Experience from Powertrain embedded Software development
  
Experience from setting up test strategies and automate test as part of release process for embedded software system
  
Experience from Interface communication such as CAN, Ethernet, DDS, UDS
  
Experience within the automotive industry

title: Field Service Engineer II
description:
**Work Schedule**


Standard (Mon-Fri)**Environmental Conditions**


Able to lift 40 lbs. without assistance, Adherence to all Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) Safety Standards**Job Description**


We are seeking an experienced Field Service Engineer to join our BioProduction Service and Support team. In this role, you will travel to customer sites to install, service, update, and repair Thermo Fisher Single Use Technology (SUT) hardware and automation products.  

This is a field-based role, primarily providing support to customers across the Nordics, UK and Ireland. In time, you will also support the full EMEA region. The role will require frequent travel on a weekly basis (75-100% of work time) to sites across EMEA. When not travelling, you will be able to work from home. We are ideally looking for a FSE based out in the Netherland.  

  

What will you do?  

* Support our customers by providing troubleshooting, installation, Preventative Maintenance (PM), repair services, verification and qualification services in a professional and timely manner
* Perform commissioning and qualification of equipment by implementing Site Acceptance Test (SAT) and Installation/Operational Qualification (IQ/OQ) Protocols
* Collaborate with internal partners to resolve customer issues and improve processes
* Provide basic product training and technical assistance on our instrumentation to our customers and internal Sales team
* Report all activities on Sales Force Service desk, providing customer feedback to management, hardware and software groups
* Aid in optimizing revenue and new product development opportunities; Assist in demonstration of our products to potential customers
* Maintain technical competency by attending trainings, employee meetings and remaining up to speed on new products, markets, customers and competitors


Who we are looking for:  

* A degree in Mechanical, Electrical or Software Engineering (or similar), or equivalent work experience and knowledge
* Delta V or other control software experience preferred
* Some experience with Single Use Technology (upstream and/or downstream) preferred
* Commissioning and Qualifications (C&Q) experience in facility, equipment or utilities
* Knowledge of Corrective Action and Preventive Action (CAPA), change control, deviations management and document management systems
* Any experience with in the Field Service, Lab Maintenance or Calibration Engineering roles working with IVD instrumentation or medical devices of interest
* Comfortable working in a customer-facing role, with a customer centric approach
* Proficient in English (crucial); additional Nordic languages a plus
* A valid Driver’s Licence (required)
* Willing and able to travel extensively, sometimes at short notice (crucial)
* Self-sufficient; comfortable working independently; logical approach in setting work priorities

title: Marine Operations Project Engineer - Wave Energy
description:
Working at CorPower Ocean you will be part of a world class team, determined to make big impact. We are on a mission to bring reliable and competitive wave energy to the world. We offer a high degree of autonomy, combined with great personal responsibility. CorPower Ocean is a global leader in wave energy, with a technology that has shown game-changing performance. Your work will contribute to the global transition to renewable energy by unlocking one of the largest untapped sources of clean energy on earth.


**The Role**


CorPower Ocean is looking for a Marine Operations Project Engineer to take a key role in the preparation and installation of CorPower wave farms. This includes preparation of procedures for loadout, transport and installation of anchor, array cables and electrical collection hubs as well as the procedures for transport, connection and disconnection of Wave Energy Converters (WECs). As a Marine Operations Project Engineer in CorPower Ocean you are also responsible for specifying or selecting and sourcing equipment, deck spreads, tooling, rigging and sea fastening required for the offshore campaigns.


**Responsibilities**

* Methods and equipment for marine operations (Piling, cable install, hub, LARS for WEC operations)
* Development and continuous improvement of Method statements, including MWS approval
* Ensure that CorPower engineering QHSE and risk assessment are performed in accordance with CorPower Ocean and local regulations policy
* Responsible for FAT or SAT for the installation aids and installation spreads for the farm infrastructure
* Selection and contracting with Marine operators and equipment suppliers for farm infrastructure installations. (WEC operations is distributed on Local Heads of WEC marine operations)
* Development of improved methods and equipment to meet Installation and O&M targets in terms of safety, cycle time, performance and reduction in ops-CAPEX and OPEX to deliver on CorPower's Product Roadmap, defined in the Installation and OPEX sections.
* Develop and maintain the marine ops processes, policies and procedures in CorPower. Train teams and ensure operations are executed to the procedures.
* Lead development of future marine operations methods and tooling
* Direct, review and update procedures to meet internal targets and external requirements from customers, investors, MWS, DNV and underwriters

**Skills and requirements**


You have a minimum of 2-5 years of relevant experience developing offshore installation methods and have successfully executed installations in the field. Proven experience in method development processes and installation cycles from start to finish is a must.


You have a broad technical knowledge and genuine interest in the different aspects of marine operations, vessels, equipment, and operational methods. Human and asset safety through each stage of operation is your top priority. Knowledge of engineering, sourcing and operation of mooring systems, ROVs, and subsea tooling, cable lay spreads, cranes and winches and vessels is qualifying. Experience of certification and Marine Warranty Survey methodology and documentation is qualifying


You have experience in creating deck layouts, rigging sketches, storyboards using 2D CAD software. If you have experience with Orcaflex and simplified sea fastening design, this is also qualifying.


You may have a B.Sc or a M.Sc. degree in marine engineering or related disciplines, but your personality, experience and interest in the field is the most important. You are proficient in English, both spoken and written. Your personality, experience and interest in the field are the most important and what is most highly valued at CorPower.


**As a person:**

* You are striving for excellence, put quality into everything you do
* You are self-motivated and constantly seek the most efficient ways to work
* You always search for simple and elegant solutions to difficult problems
* You love to learn new things, and take pride in constantly developing your skills
* You are persistent, knowing it takes stamina to reach pioneering goals
* You see your tasks through to completion
* You are comfortable in presenting your solutions internally and externally
* You are data driven and strive to always back your points with solid analysis


CorPower Ocean has a highly diversified team with many nationalities and backgrounds, all working towards the same goal. This is something we are very proud of.

title: Principal Silicon Design Engineer
description:
Overview:
**WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING**
At AMD, our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences—from AI and data centers, to PCs, gaming and embedded systems. Grounded in a culture of innovation and collaboration, we believe real progress comes from bold ideas, human ingenuity and a shared passion to create something extraordinary. When you join AMD, you’ll discover the real differentiator is our culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges—striving for execution excellence, while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives. Join us as we shape the future of AI and beyond. **Together, we advance your career.**
Responsibilities:
**PRINCIPAL SILICON DESIGN ENGINEER**  

  

**THE ROLE:**Based in our office in Gothenburg, Sweden, we are seeking an outstanding engineer with a passion for processor design and verification to define, specify, develop, and verify new and enhanced functionality in the AMD MicroBlaze V RISC-V processor and other related Intellectual Property cores.  

You will join a team whose design and development activities cover a wide range of disciplines including specification, implementation, verification, benchmarking and analysis of the processor and cache coherency architectures  

  

This senior role will stretch you as you participate in the microprocessor design team, network with our world-class, patent-holding think-tank, and collaborate with design teams, marketing, and business unit executives.  

  

**THE PERSON:**You have excellent communication and presentation skills. You are highly adept at collaboration among top-thinkers and engineers alike, ready to mentor and guide, and help to elevate the knowledge and skills of the team around you.  

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**

  

* Improving and extending the MicroBlaze RTL implementation on the next generation architectures both for use by customers and internally for hard blocks in our devices
* Participating in definition of product features and capabilities, based on architecture, and micro-architecture requirements, and develop technical specifications to meet those requirements
* Applying strong software engineering skills to enable the definition, implementation and verification of key application use cases
* Functional/performance validation and analysis of the architecture for various application scenarios
* Technically interact with internal engineering teams, support teams and external customers
* Author product and user guides for the team Intellectual Property cores
* Knowledge sharing and other contributions to Platform & System Architecture
* Support Post-Si teams for Product Performance, Power and functional issues debug/resolution
* Teamwork across multiple geographical sites


**PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:*** Detailed knowledge of microprocessor architecture, with expertise in CPU design, FPGA architecture, coherency, Security, and Functional Safety
* Strong VHDL and System Verilog experience
* Verification methodologies such as UVM and formal methods
* Well versed in scripting using Tcl, Perl and Python languages
* Strong C programming experience
* Experience in RTL synthesis, timing optimization, low power design and power optimization
* Cache coherency acceleration and industry standard protocols such as CXL
* AMD Vivado and Vitis tools
* Excellent communication, management, and presentation skills
* Adept at collaboration with strong interpersonal skills to work across teams in different geographies


**ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:*** Master’s degree in related discipline preferred


**Location:*** Gothenburg, Sweden (This role is not based in Stockholm)


#LI-ME
#LI-ONSITE
#LI-HYBRID  


Qualifications:
*Benefits offered are described:* AMD benefits at a glance*.* *AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.*

title: Systems Engineer - Satellite Communications
description:
Description


Welcome to SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, the perfect workplace for those passionate about technology in general and space in particular.
With space organizations, research institutes, institutional and commercial actors as customers, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications, space consulting services, rocket and balloon systems, flight test services, satellite propulsion systems, and much more.


Do you want to play a critical role in enabling communication for missions around Earth, and beyond? Join us at SSC, where we help the world’s spacecraft talk to Earth!


At SSC, we operate a global network of ground stations and deliver mission-critical communication services. Our services are integral to our customers’ mission success, from launch to Lunar space operations.


We are now expanding our Systems Engineering team and looking for both experienced and junior Systems Engineers for satellite communications. If you have experience in space operations or spacecraft communications, we especially encourage you to apply.


Requirements


**YOUR ROLE**
As a Systems Engineer at SSC, you will:

* Lead the development and integration of customers' space missions into our service system, ensuring they have efficient and reliable communications for successful space missions.
* Work on development projects to improve our systems, capabilities, and service offerings.
* Act as a Subject Matter Expert in discussions with customers, suppliers, and internal stakeholders.
* Drive projects, analyses, and technical investigations.
* Provide technical support to sales in bids and proposals.


Responsibilities


**WHO YOU ARE**
We’re looking for candidates who:

* Have excellent technical skills and a desire to learn new things, likely excited about the growing space industry.
* Can communicate complex technical solutions clearly and effectively.
* Are comfortable writing documentation, and following, and improving, engineering processes
* Have ability to lead own work, independently or in a team.
* Experience with both hardware and software systems is valued, as SSC’s services span across ground infrastructure, RF systems, and software-defined mission solutions.
* Hold a Bachelor's, Master's degree or PhD in electrical engineering, space technology, or similar.
  

While not required, we especially value experience in:

* Some years of experience in systems engineering including both hardware and software components.
* Spacecraft operations or spacecraft communications (TT&C, mission control systems, space-ground interfaces).
* A demonstrated drive to run projects, ideas or concepts. We’re happy to see your GitHub repos if available, or other technical projects that you have done.
* Ground station hardware, RF signal chains, modulation/coding schemes, and protocols (e.g. CCSDS).
* Documented knowledge of a major programming/scripting language and knowledge of software architectures and trends.
* Linux environments, including configuration, Docker, and networking.


Benefits


**WE OFFER YOU*** A unique opportunity to contribute to a wide range of projects and play an active role in both the Swedish and international space industry.
* An excellent opportunity for personal and career development.
* An exciting, international workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world.

**Additional benefits*** In addition to vacation and traditional public holidays, we offer extra paid leave throughout the year, such as time off between Christmas and New Year, Ascension Day, amounting to 6-11 extra days depending on the calendar.
* Wellness allowance of SEK 5,000 per year.
* Health benefits such as voluntary health insurance and regular health checks for eligible employees.
* Access to a benefit bike through a tax-efficient leasing program.
* Support for employee-driven activities that promote connection, health, and culture across teams.
* Collective Agreement, including good pensions plans, parental pay and insurance.

  

**LOCATION**


This is a full-time, permanent position based at our office in either Solna or Kiruna.

 **FURTHER INFORMATION**


For questions regarding the position, you are welcome to contact:  

**Petrus Hyvönen, Head of Engineering** (petrus.hyvonen@sscspace.com)


For questions regarding employment terms or union-related matters, you are welcome to contact our union representatives:  

**Sveriges Ingenjörer**: SverigesIngenjorer-AF@sscspace.com  

**Unionen**: unionen@sscspace.com

 **NEXT STEP**


If this opportunity sparks your interest, don’t wait to apply! Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis, and interviews will be conducted continuously. We kindly ask you to submit your CV when applying. While you are welcome to include a brief personal note or letter, our evaluation will primarily focus on your skills and qualifications as outlined in your CV, ensuring a fair and unbiased recruitment process.


Please note that the job advertisement may close earlier than the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications. This allows us to ensure a fair and efficient recruitment process and give each application the attention it deserves.

  

  

This is a security-classified position and will require a background check prior to employment.


We welcome your application no later than 2025-12-08. **WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE**


Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.
With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.


 We help Earth benefit from Space. Learn more at sscspace.com

title: System Integration engineer
description:
We develop and manufacture turnkey energy storage solutions, based on lithium-ion battery technology. Our goal is to engineer technology that both stores and optimizes energy as we shift towards more efficient energy usage and renewable energy sources on a global scale. You’ll have the opportunity to work with exceptional engineers, scientists, developers and more to pave the way for the next big leap in the energy industry through our battery energy storage and optimization systems.

***Location: Stockholm***

***Responsibilities:***

* Design and develop system solutions, including electrical hardware and control systems
* Prepare comprehensive technical documentation, including system design specifications, integration plans, test reports and as-built documentation.
* Develop and execute test plans and procedures to validate system operation, performance, and compliance to project specifications.
* Conduct system-level testing and verifications validate the functionality and performance of integrated BESS components.
* Collaborate with software developers to implement custom control algorithms and optimize system performance
* Analyze system performance data, Identify potential issues or improvements, and propose solutions to optimize BESS performance and efficiency.
* Collaborate with cross functional teams to resolve technical issues, troubleshoot system integration problems, and ensure timely project delivery.
* Provide technical guidance to junior engineers, fostering their professional growth and development.
* Provide technical expertise and support to sales and business development teams during the pre-sales phase, including system design, technical proposals, and customer presentations
* Stay updated with the industry trends, emerging technologies, and regulatory requirements related to Battery Energy Storage Systems
* System integration planning and system design and integration

 ***Qualifications and experience:***

* Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering, or a related field. Master´s degree is a plus
* Proven experience in system integration and commisioning of Battery Energy Storage Systems, preferrably up to 10 Megawatts.
* In-depth knowledge of battery technologies, energy storage systems, power electronics, and control systems
* Strong understanding of electrical distribution systems, grid interfaces, communication protocols (e.g. Modbus, DNP3 or EMS)
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
* 

**About you:**

* Strong passion for renewable energy, energy storage, and sustainable technologies
* Ability to lead and inspire a team, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
* Excellent teamwork and interpersonal skills.
* Continuous learning mindset and eagerness to stay updated with industry advancements
* Driver license class B.

**We offer**

  

* Wellness contribution
* Five extra flexibility days
* Pension


Kindly submit your application through the provided apply button in the advertisement on our careers page, as we are unable to accept any applications via email in compliance with the GDPR regulations.


At Polarium, creating change in the energy industry starts with our team. We believe a diverse workplace brings creativity, innovation and better represents our customers, and the many communities they serve, around the world. A positive work-life balance is what supercharges our teamwork and a sustainable personal journey throughout our careers.


Since Polarium launched in 2015, we’ve been on a mission to redesign the energy industry. We’re unlocking the massive potential of energy storage systems through our wide range of intelligent and digital services. Our passion for solving challenges is what drives our next generation of premium energy storage products in use on all continents and in all climate zones. Today, we power businesses, optimize energy usage, and reduce carbon dioxide emissions to create a cleaner future in energy.


We look forward to receiving your application!
